But their version was some sort of horrible action film about a math genius on the lam from a crooked government trying to exploit his talents, involving high-speed car chases and buildings exploding etc. It wasn't until William Goldman, an experienced screenwriter was hired, that the film became this "inner-growth and maturity" story that eventually got released. Goldman wrote the bulk of the screenplay alone and didn't even get credit as a script-consultant. As far as the credits of the film are concerned, he wasn't even there. Of course Damon and Affleck came up with the main-character and some of the stuff in the script themselves, but they did not write the script that was actually filmed. And it really makes sense. How could two such inexperienced writers produce a first screenplay of such quality and go from rags to riches literally overnight? Sounds exciting doesn't it? Just the kind of story Hollywood likes to tell. Matt Damon and Ben Affleck give even better performances in real life than in the film itself. For those who are in doubt, check out their writing filmography and see how many films they have written since GWH.

title: Better late than never.
content: It's a lonely feeling to finally watch such a popular and critically-acclaimed movie like Good Will Hunting, and be wondering what all the fuss was about. Sure it's been a few years since it was released, but movies this highly praised usually stand up to the test of time.So I didn't think it was amazing...but it was good. It's the kind of underdog story that pulls at the heartstrings, and I imagine that a large portion of its popularity comes from that fact. Matt Damon is just a great actor in every movie he ever does, Minnie Driver was aces, and Robin Williams made the rare decision to showcase the portion of his talent that doesn't make me want to slap him.Good Will Hunting is a solid movie, and it's really a shame that it has taken me so long to see it. Solid, but not spectacular.

title: Certainly a Masterpiece
content: Not sure why I took so long to see this movie, but having seen performances from all the main actors in this film, I don't think any of them have done any better since this film.While the movie is formulaic, the performances of Robin Williams, Matt Damon, and Minnie Driver allow you to overlook that. Williams very much deserved his Oscar and I can't think of anybody who could have played his role any better than him. Damon has always struck me as a smart and cocky type of person but for a few fleeting moments, shows real vulnerability. And with the way the movie ends, we don't have to judge Driver's performance based on how her character reacts.But overall, a movie that is very much worth seeing if you haven't seen it before.

title: Big Deal
content: Often, when a Robin Williams character is the most palatable feature of a film, the film may be avoided and the filmgoer's admission may be saved and the filmgoer may enjoy $7.00 worth of candy and cake (There are exceptions - "Dead Poets'" is one, of course).  Good Will Hunting doubtlessly sold lots of issues of Teen People magazine - but it also kept a lot of good filmgoers from enjoying a lot of good candy and cake.-That's what I think.

title: Raw, feel good, and everything done with perfection.
content: This movie could easily drown in the grave yard of "broken orphan boy finds his pathway"trope. But this felt so raw throughout the course, each scenes and dialogues are so well thought out. Robin Williams as a therapist was the exact bowl of endearing optimism that we need more in these feel good movies. It was encouraging enough and not over the top preachy. The hero's journey felt organic and the plots seem well paced and not stretched or rushed to engage with the viewers attention.This is a fantastic masterpiece of how to make a simple movie within the classically loved tropes without it feeling monotonous. I'll rewatch if from time to time.

title: Thought provoking
content: This movie will always have a special place in my heart.Maybe it is because it was the last movie I saw together with my seven year long girl-friend before we split...Maybe it is because I am on my way of becoming a psychotherapist for children and adolescents just like Robin Williams is in this movie...Or maybe it is just because it is a damn good movie with brilliant actors Williams, Damon and Affleck.I loved nearly every minute of it. The characters were complex and very realistic, and the inner conflict of Matt Damon was so strongly played you could actually see it in the air.I especially loved the scene where Affleck shouts at Damon who wants to carry on being a construction worker instead of using his incredible talent...One of the most splendid movies of the 90s.

title: Hell and the Lonely genius
content: When searching for intellectual success and humanistic relationships between life and career, there is a simple formula which works for a few people. It is an equation which reads, Superior intellectual equals power, but results in pain and isolation. Such is the story of Will Hunting, superbly played by Matt Damon. Born with a I. Q. Genius, the young man seeks friends and mathematical challenges alike. Consequently when he finds either, he attacks one and embraces the other. As a result, he lives in a world of turmoil and volatile possibilities. Unable to tolerate authoritative or academic hypocrisy, he armors himself with the sword and shield of intellectual arrogance and gives battle to anyone and everything around him. What troubles him the most is the dark pain of abuse in his youth and it is here he is most vulnerable. Robin Williams who portrays Dr. Sean Maguire give one of his most stirring performances as a sensitive and compassionate psychiatrist. Equally matched as they are adroit, the two battle in an emotional arena, each seeking to fathom the other. The result? The creation of a truly remarkable film. ****

title: refreshingly different
content: Good Will Hunting is one movie that makes reaffirms your faith in hollywood. thank heavens for matt damon & ben affleck. one of the most refreshing & original movies in a long time. a movie that keeps its own pace and explores the psychology of the characters or rather the key character here - will hunting.matt damon as will hunting is excellent, and the same goes for ben affleck & minnie driver - but veteran robin williams steals the show as the psychiatrist trying to bring the best out of will hunting and guiding him towards the light.the authors do a credible job in making the chracters believable and lovable. one of the best screenplays in a long time.a solid 9.

title: This movie made me come back to loving cinema
content: I watched and rewatched this movie from time to time and it nevers comes short of a great time.In a era of cinema marked by remakes, social messages and quick and shallow plots, this movie made me come back to the cinema art in search for old and hidden gems such as these.I didn't even choose to watch it for the first time, it was just playing on the tv while i was doing other stufff. After a short time, i stopped all and just enjoyed what i didn't felt for a long time... a sense of glancing over a masterpiece.The dialogue, acting and tone of Good Will Hunting immerses you in the movie in a smart and beatiful way that makes you wonder about your own life, fears and goals.Its a history of fear and pain but also of friendship, rough truth and overcoming.STOP SEARCHING! THIS IS THE MOVIE!

title: A classic film
content: This is a classic film in my opinion, right up next to the Breakfast Club. It is one that will never go out of style, and will never stop being great. Matt Damon is a phenomenal actor, and really dives right into this character in the best way. The supporting characters are also phenomenal and you almost immediately become attached to them, and want to see them grow. The script is very well-done, with snarky little phrases and witty remarks scattered throughout. Again, something that will never go out of style. The storyline is so compelling. You really get to see Matt Damon's character grow and change into this phenomenal man. I think all audiences love to see that in movies- major character growth. I originally started watching this movie for Matt Damon, and because I had heard of it many times before but never watched it. And I am glad I finally made the time to watch it. The styling was one of my favorites from any movie I have seen thus far. The costumes were fun and matched each character perfectly, I loved getting to see Matt Damon's character's friends outfits especially. Overall, a great film and a classic that everyone should watch. It is lighthearted but impactful, and I think it would appeal anyone, not matter which type of film is your favorite. I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a fun friday night movie.

title: Van Sant is the real star
content: I had a real problem with the sentimentality of this movie. It drips with string-tugging melodrama and amateurish characterizations. The only movies that can get away with such tortured pop psychology were all made by Alfred Hitchcock.I liked Minnie Driver and Ben Affleck, accent or no (it's hard to tell), and Robin Williams was OK. Matt Damon's character is so depressingly obvious that it's difficult to sit through his journey to self-awareness, and the epiphany scene is just embarrassing.But I can't say enough about Gus Van Sant and his deceptively transparent direction. Somehow he makes the flat script come alive with just a few touches. Notice how he uses the stationary and panning shots - and how he frames each image to make it vital. This is especially true for the scenes with Driver. I'm not a Van Sant fan, but I think he really lifted this movie up by its wet corners and tried his best to give it life.

title: Rough start, better finish
content: The first half was difficult to get through. I kept thinking - they won best original screenplay for this? Once Robin Williams enters, the turn happens and the film drastically improves.Matt Damon is stellar in the role, able to reach huge range with his role. However I wanted to throw something at Ben Affleck. The accent... Gah! Awful. The positive is he drops it for all future roles and is much improved.Truly an award winning performance from Williams. You can see him slip into the comedic role at times, but it's subtle and not over the top like he usually is.Overall, good film, fantastic performances.

title: Great movie can't believe I only saw it recently.
content: GWH is a great drama about an extremely unlikely scenario.Read Synapsis for that but Genius Mat Damon lol.This is a great script and the writers play main characters really cool move.Robin Williams is amazing as per usual in one of his most powerful but deep roles.Teaching youngish people about life outside their tiny bubble is a heck of a thing.Math, Art, Love everyday toil and dark childhood are all covered .Parental warning this is a rated R movie about young men.The detail are also wrong R for strong language sexual innuendo and sexuality, also violence peril and a good bit of drinking.Smoking would be included today but not really back then.Honestly the math stuff was way over my head but enjoyed the movie very much.

title: Good Will Hunting
content: 9/10 - the movie that made Matt Damon and Ben Affleck stars is an effective drama with plenty of heart

title: Wholesome AF
content: Yeah this is better than an alright movie. The casting is excellent, every character plays their role so extremely well and gives of such an emotional performance, especially Matt Damon. There are so many wise words as well that work so excellently throughout, there is so many hidden meanings in this movie. The romance side of the story, I found to be the lowest part of the movie, it was interesting enough but I preferred the teachings of Robin Williams character and seeing his chemistry with Will. I also thought there was going to be more about how incredibly smart Will was, which don't get me wrong there was, but there were other focuses that stood out. This movie is what me and my friends like to call an insta-classic, it well...instantly becomes a classic, pretty self explanatory. It truly is a heartwarming story with great characters, you can't go wrong. 9/10

title: Good
content: The most amazing movie I've ever seen, so touched i love it so much

title: A classic film about self-discovery
content: If you have not seen Good Will Hunting(1997), it is probably the defining film about the road to self discovery.A troubled young man with an incredibly brilliant mind, Will Hunting(played by Matt Damon) has to meet with a psychologist named Shawn(played by Robbin Williams) who in turn helps him try to open up and be himself. At the same time, a prestigious math professor wants Will to be the brilliant man he wishes he was. The dialogue and acting in this movie is fantastic. There are so many defining scenes in the movie.The whole film basically revolves along realized potential and finding your way in life. There is one scene in a bar between the math professor and the psychologist that seemed to define the whole movie for me.Overall one of my favorite films.

title: This movie has the most satisfying character development I've ever seen.
content: I absolutely love this movie, and seeing all of the characters finally move past there perpetual lifestyles is nothing short of exilerating. The characters feel like real people, this fact makes the emotional moments so intense,

title: Matt Damon sticks to the formula in this cliche ridden drama.
content: Haven't we seen this one before? Matt Damon must have looked at everything that's won awards in the history of the Academy and included every cliche he could scavenge into his screenplay.1. The angst-ridden genius who resents his gift, because everybody he knows is trying to force him into a better life. A life he doesn't want because he's happy just being an average loser like all his friends.2. The teacher who discovers him, who we are meant to believe genuinely wants to help him, but by the end we find out just wants to live his own lost dreams vicariously through his prodigy.3. The psychiatrist who has troubles of his own, so by the end of the film they unwittingly help each other out.4. Of course a romantic interest has to be thrown in to create the standard conflict. Should he choose a life with his friends, his girl, or a high paying job. Naturally he chooses to abandon everything and run off to a girl he barely knows. I hope I'm not the only one who saw that coming a mile away. Men are always portrayed as saps in these types of films.Robin Williams gives us another one of his trademark two characters. He's always either manic and over-the-top, or quiet and introverted. In this case we get the latter, essentially the same guy we saw in Awakenings. I prefer him in the manic roles, at least then I don't have to suspend my disbelief enough to accept Mork giving psychological advice.

title: only here for robin williams lol
content: Good Will Hunting is a pretty good coming-of-age movie. It's about the man, Will, who has a genius-level IQ and he worked at MIT as a janitor. The math professor discovered his talent and wanted to help him to achieve his success. When Will was arrested, the professor made a deal that Will would work with him as he get therapy. Overall, the movie has good psychological thinking and it talks about certain heavy topics. There are some plot holes and the fighting scenes, in the beginning, aren't executed well. However, I love Robin Williams' acting.

title: The realism and authenticity is unbelievable
content: Today I am ending my birthday on a high by reviewing my all time favourite movie. Good Will Hunting Directed by Gus Van Sant, contains such an incredible screenplay written by Matt Damon and Ben Affleck. The plot is simply based on a genius who isn't living to his potential due to the traumatic impact of his past. For a topic which has been attempted countless times in film history, Good Will Hunting still holds the benchmark. Each and every word of the script is perfection. Moments of outrage as well as moments of therapy contain some of the most well written lines in cinema. Robin Williams' performance was truly inspiring. His line delivery has a way of transcending the screen and connecting with the audience on a deep, emotional level. I say this is my favourite film due to the fact that it is talented film making in its barest form. All that is required is a great script and talented performances, in order to create such a timeless film. This movie holds up incredibly well. Age hasn't made it less powerful or emotionally outdated. This is one of the very few films which actually impacted my personal life and changed my mindset. The bleak visuals together with Elliot Smith's melancholy music, establishes such a beautiful, sorrowful tone throughout the entire runtime. Not once do I ever believe I am watching a film whilst sitting through Good Will Hunting. The realism and authenticity is unbelievable. If you haven't seen Good Will Hunting, you're currently deprived from one of the greatest films in history. This film repeatedly leaves me in awe each and every time I experience it. Good Will Hunting is undoubtably a 10. I recommended reading through screenplay after watching the film. It's an absolute masterpiece.

title: Cliched, unreal, predictable and manipulative
content: I'm not surprised that so many people fell for this one. When I was watching this movie, a couple viewers next to me sobbed whenever you're "supposed" to sob -- or at least feel "touched". Like when Hunting said he didn't love the girl. Like when Robin Williams' character (sorry I forgot his role's name) was telling Hunting repeatedly "It's not your fault" (oh Lord, just thinking of that scene gives me the goosebumps). I couldn't have cared less for what would happen to the characters. Many people sob for Hollywood manufactured characters they can't even relate to (think Titanic; Yuck!)... but it really only made me cringe and want to get out of the theatre. I guess I simply refuse to be psychically and emotionally manipulated by all this.Folks it's not me who's being condescending ... those characters are, and for no good reason because they're unreal. Worse yet, nothing is new or surprising. Even Robin Williams' character is all cliched.I gave it 1 out of 10. It's probably not that bad; it's just quite mediocre... but so many people went to the other extreme and gave it a 10 so I figured a single balancing vote won't hurt.

title: Great! will hunting
content:
Not many movies make me emotional enough to shed a tear. This one did on multiple occasions. On an airplane. Which is not the proper conditions for an emotional outburst. But it happened. God knows what would've happened if I watched this in the privacy of my own home! Stellar film with a chuck ton of heart. Felt authentic, was original.I liked how it portrayed relationships
Relationships between friends, and the safe loyalty that comes with that. I enjoyed the reality shown in Wills relationship with skyla. The natural fears many of us face with love. It spoke to the heart, because it got to the heart and it told the truth. Love is scary! Life is scary and imperfect. I think this film portrayed this imperfect reality well. I think sometimes in an effort to show the imperfections of life a movie can get pretty sloppy, like the fabelmans for example. That shows a messy life. And it left me feeling gross. But this film felt real, and full of hope and light. It's a film about overcoming! Really great film.

title: Good memories
content: I watched this movie in math class back in Father Henry Carr in 2015 I think? It has "Hey! Do you like apples? Well yeah? How do you like them apples?!" and it has "He stole my line."

title: A Masterpiece of Emotional Depth
content: "Good Will Hunting," directed by Gus Van Sant and written by Matt Damon and Ben Affleck, is a deeply moving and captivating film. The story follows Will Hunting (Matt Damon), a genius janitor at MIT, whose extraordinary mathematical abilities catch the eye of Professor Gerald Lambeau (Stellan Skarsgård). Therapist Sean Maguire (Robin Williams) helps Will confront his past and embrace his potential. Damon's and Williams' performances are exceptional, delivering raw and genuine emotion. The film's authentic Boston setting and Elliott Smith's poignant music enhance its impact. This inspiring masterpiece earns a perfect 10/10.

title: A soulful masterpiece
content: Good Will Hunting is all about self-discovery, and it packs a powerful message about compassion and finding your true self. The characters are real, relatable, and will stay with you for ages.I gotta be real, though. If you're looking for non-stop action or crazy twists, this might not be your jam. It's more about the characters and their emotional journey, so it takes its time. But trust me, it's worth every minute.The acting is off the charts! Matt Damon nails it as Will Hunting, showing his intelligence, pain, and even humor with pure authenticity. And Robin Williams as the therapist, Sean Maguire, is like the perfect balance to Will. Williams brings the feels, man, and you'll be reaching for the tissues. A well-deserved Oscar for him.

title: Masterpiece
content: This film is undeniably a masterpiece, reminiscent of a time when movies carried profound messages. While it may be considered a slow-burner, every moment is deliberate and purposeful, leading to a deeply intense psychological journey culminating in a beautifully crafted catharsis.The portrayal of a man (Will) grappling with profound emotional wounds, shying away from intimacy and cloaking himself in defense mechanisms, resonates profoundly with viewers. This raw depiction may challenge some, as it reflects aspects of their own lives back to them. However, it's precisely this introspective quality that makes the film so impactful. The iconic scene where Sean repeatedly reassures Will affirming that it's not his fault, delivers the catharsis viewers crave.The stellar acting and brilliant script are made even more impressive by the fact that they were penned by two 25-year-old writers. Their ability to delve into such profound psychological depths surpasses that of many individuals twice their age, making this film a remarkable achievement in storytelling.

title: Watch it for Williams turn as the mentor.
content: One of the finest performances of Robin Williams Good Will hunting is a good film with an impeccable script by Matt Damon and Ben Affleck. Robin Williams is great as the tutor and won the best supporting actor for the role. Gus Van Sant has a great track record and he is very good here. If you like strong hard hitting films with a lesson than you cannot go wrong with Good Will Hunting.

title: A math genius that never reads a book
content: The movie tells a very touching story about a math genius. However, I was surprised that although he solves very difficult math problems that the renowned professor couldn't do, and he quotes long excerpts from historical books in front of other boys and girls to show his deep knowledge and talent, however, we never see him reads in a book, or holds a book or has a book at his home. This is not convincing. Being a genius does not mean he solves complicated problems by heart. It's not a revelation. Maths means a lot of research, thinking and reading and experimenting, and you get baffled how he became such a gifted person when he did not show any of these functions or reflect any love for or close relation to books.

title: Good Will Hunting
content: Good Will Hunting is a 1997 American psychological drama film directed by Gus Van Sant, and written by Ben Affleck and Matt Damon. It stars Robin Williams, Damon, Affleck, Stellan Skarsgård and Minnie Driver.The film received positive reviews from critics and grossed over $225 million during its theatrical run against a $10 million budget. At the 70th Academy Awards, it received nominations in nine categories, including Best Picture and Best Director, and won in two: Best Supporting Actor for Williams and Best Original Screenplay for Affleck and Damon. In 2014, it was ranked at number 53 in The Hollywood Reporter's "100 Favorite Films" list.[

title: Good film with Robin
content: The guys deserve great credit for tackling a serious issue with their first screenplay and not merely filling the script with a lot of scatological humour (Though there is some of that here too, it just doesn't seem out of place) All of the characters are well rounded and sympathetic in some way, and you never feel they are there simply out of formula or to further the plot. The development of the story grows organically through the characters. Even Skylar, the love interest (played beautifully by Minnie Driver, as too are the rest of the performances great) is an interesting character in her own right and someone we want to follow through the story. The only measurable difference between her role and that of Matt Damon's is that he has more screen time, but this is understandable, given that he is the title character.In reply to those who say that the repeated profanity use highlights a lack of writing skills, I disagree.

title: and now, ABC After school special presents.
content: So many fans, so little to show for it.  I know, I know, these words are gonna find me in a great minority.  A lot of people really liked Good Will Hunting.  But seriously please, great film making, not even close, and let's put the blame where it belongs...  in the writing.Now, I know they won an oscar for it, and boy did they look good emoting on the screen.  But Good Will Hunting is an ABC after school special with lots of cursing in it, and a slightly bigger budget.What this movie does show, is the brilliance of Harvey Weinstein and Miramax Pictures. Mr. Weinstein could take manure, feed it to you, and make you believe your eating bon bons.  And that's exactly what the studio did with the film. They created such high faluttin buzz around it, that people believed, and wanted to believe it so much --- that they saw brilliance where there was none.Now, I know some people think it's a great movie, I don't think it's a horribly bad movie, I like to compare it to more in the middle of the road movies, and also to some great Made for TV movies (although, not HBO films, HBO films are unusually better than Good Will Hunting would ever be.) It's just a nice, little film, with some good performances, Robin Williams was not good in it, they just gave him the oscar cause the'd been itching to do it for a while.  And of course, the Miramax public relations machine secured Ben and Matt their screenwriting oscar... but come one people... there's better movies out there thatn GWH.

title: Fantastic script & great acting.
content: A must watch. Robin Williams and Matt Damon were fantastic. An emotional story and a very finely executed drama with romance, violence, fight against authorities & the realisation that you can be the smartest person in the room without a college degree or certification to your name. It also carries deep messages about relationships, friendships, learning to trust yourself and other people - and most of all you are not your situation or your background. You have the power to choose your story, your path and your legacy.A star-studded cast in my opinion & it definitely lived up to expectations. Terrific.

title: Very Interesting Movie
content: I had never heard of this movie when it came out in 1997. At least I don't remember. I came across this movie watching Starz. It is a great movie to watch and enjoyable. I recommend this as a good movie to see.

title: They don't make movies like this anymore
content:
A beautiful look at life, love, & purpose. Some of the most moving dialogue that is grounded by genuine acting. The themes of healing, fear of failure, & potential to overcome hardship are highly emotional. Simple & meaningful..
..
A beautiful look at life, love, & purpose. Some of the most moving dialogue that is grounded by genuine acting. The themes of healing, fear of failure, & potential to overcome hardship are highly emotional. Simple & meaningful..

A beautiful look at life, love, & purpose. Some of the most moving dialogue that is grounded by genuine acting. The themes of healing, fear of failure, & potential to overcome hardship are highly emotional. Simple & meaningful.

title: Amazing
content: The definition of a timeless movies. The lessons that are taught throughout still hold up in modern times. This is a classic featuring a little bit of everything that you want in a movie including comedy, love, and lots of character growth. Even though no one reading this is probably as smart as Will is in the movie you are still able to find him relatable. This is a cast that is full of stars including Matt Damon, Robin Williams, and Ben Affleck and they do not disappoint all playing their characters to perfection . This is a movie that you can watch on a date or just sitting around with your friends.

title: "It's Not Your Fault" - A Heartfelt Journey in Good Will Hunting
content: Good Will Hunting is a profoundly moving film that left a lasting impression on me. The story of Will, a janitor with a genius-level intellect, is both heart-wrenching and inspiring. The screenplay, written by Matt Damon and Ben Affleck, is exceptional, offering a perfect blend of humor, drama, and deep emotional moments. The performances are top-notch, especially Robin Williams, whose portrayal of the compassionate therapist is unforgettable. Matt Damon and Ben Affleck also deliver outstanding performances, bringing authenticity and depth to their characters.One of the film's strongest points is its exploration of complex themes like personal growth, the impact of trauma, and the importance of relationships. The dialogue is sharp and meaningful, making every interaction significant and engaging. The scene where Will breaks down in front of his therapist is particularly powerful, highlighting the film's emotional core.Overall, Good Will Hunting is a timeless classic that resonates on multiple levels. It's a film that not only entertains but also provokes thought and reflection. I highly recommend it to anyone who appreciates a well-crafted story with compelling characters and heartfelt performances.

title: Those dialogues, wow! This movie will make you wanna major in Psychology.
content: Well deserved Oscars for Best Screenplay by Matt Damon and Ben Affleck, plus the one for Acting by the genius of Robin Williams (RIP).The majority of the dialogues are brilliant (mainly the ones that involve genuine insights and character development). It even makes you want to major in Psychology!And, yes, maybe the movie can be perceived a little bit corny sometimes; mostly because of its soundtrack and the rom-com ending, but, come on, it's a 90s movie. And, on that note, it's excellent."Every day, I come by your house and I pick you up. And we go out. We have a few drinks and a few laughs, and it's great. But you know what the best part of my day is? For about 10 seconds, from when I pull up to the curb and when I get to your door, 'cause I think maybe I'll get up there and I'll knock on the door and you won't be there. No goodbye. No see you later. No nothing. You just left. I don't know much, but I know that".

title: Good Will Hunting (1997)-A touching drama
content: Good Will Hunting is a beautiful written film that I would qualify as deeply emotional about self discovery. Matt Damon makes an excellent performance as Will Hunting, a man working as a cleaner at MIT, who possesses an incredible talent for mathematics.The strength of the film is in its awesome script, performances and its exploration in themes like friendship, love and personal growth. About the graphics I can say that I was surprised when I came up with its great definition talking about a movie from 1997.My final verdict is a nine out of ten.It is a smart, deeply human story that is worth enough to spend your time with.It is a smart, deeply human story that is worth enough to spend your time with.

title: OVERRATED
content: What a cliche! Poor and genius boy is noticed by a rich man, but poor boy is proud because of things that are in his past and denies the modern world and the richness. But then magical things happen. Our genius but poor boy turns a winner. Then he thanks everybody for his great life. THE END.I know, you see this scenario again and again. Here nothing is different. The only positive thing for this film is that it is well-acted. Nothing more...

title: The myth of "genius"
content: Enormous suspension of disbelief is required where Will's "genius" is concerned. Not just in math--he is also very well read in economic history, able to out-shrink several shrinks, etc etc. No, no, no. I don't buy it. While they're at it, they might as well have him wearing a big "S" on his chest, flying faster than a jet plane and stopping bullets.Among other problems...real genius (shelving for the moment the problem of what it really is, and whether it deserves such mindless homage) doesn't simply appear /ex nihilo/. It isn't ever so multi-faceted. And it is very rarely appreciated by contemporaries.Better to have made Will a basketball prodigy. Except that Damon's too short.

title: A star-making performance.
content: It steers well clear of unnecessary sentiment, opting instead to find the emotional reality and harshness within the story. In a movie that exudes quality, its Robin Williams that provides both its heart and its highlight.

title: goood
content:
First of all, what should happen in a masterpiece movie...? I can say that the answer to the question is hidden in this film...
i think what the director does best is adjust the emotionality of the movie in such a setting and consistency that it prolongs the pain, and it turns out to be an amazing movie I guess I've never watched such a good movie about friendship, here, here, the quality smells, you won't understand how you started the movie and when it ends, you'll even find a little more exaggeration praying that the movie doesn't end, and most importantly, of course, the exaggerated and excellent acting choice François Cluzet, I think, is a real he couldn't have been better paralyzed than paralyzed, he showed impeccable acting, and of course our nanny Omar Sy is such a warm, sincere and deeply emotional caregiver, the room was perfect, as a result, I can say a solid masterpiece that will pass you out and you will never forget, I highly recommend, by the way, the music at the end of the movie, I think I've listened to it for two minutes 20 times.

title: One of my Favourites
content: HUGE film fanatic here! There's something about 80s-90s movies that hit so differently, IF done properly. Good Will Hunting is an excellent example of this. I absolutely adore this movie. I think the concept is brilliant, I think the actors chosen are perfect, I think the busy, city life setting is the right move. There's just so much that works here for me. I think the final 10 minutes of the movie is arguably the most powerful because it leaves the the viewer saying to themselves "wow, this is it, this is the end of a young mans routine in which he's done everyday for his entire life, what's next"? That final question you ask yourself is so powerful because the director allows the viewer to becomes so "obsessed" and comfortable with Will's everyday routine, and now he's moving on to bigger and better things. Understanding this is so satisfactory because this is after all of his blood, sweat and tears. It's nice to see a genuine movie with true intentions end in such a pure way. I'm fan boying a little bit over this. Well done cast and crew.

title: Top ten movie!?
content: The pain of life can be overwhelming. It can keep you down or not. Inspiration can come from anyone, but can you be open to see it. I love this movie for the start of Matt and Ben's career. Robin Williams best role of his career. It has love, humor, and Red Sox.. lots if great American style.. dont miss it!

title: A superb story with great actors
content: Will Hunting, an apparently ordinary man, who works as a janitor for a famous school, manages to solve a very hard problem left on the hallway. Discovered by an equally famous professor, his brilliance and skill are about to be put to the test, but his very difficult character will prove to be the biggest challenge of all in his path of emancipation.It's a superb story which although at first glance doesn't sound like much, manages to create a wonderful atmosphere. We watch Will evolution from a simple janitor to someone worth being proud of, with the help of his teacher and especially a psychologist who dedicates himself to Will's case.It's a movie which understands how to create such a dramatic plot, insisting on Will's very difficult condition which made him end up in his current social position, keeping it up until the very end. The characters are very well developed and put into play, making you care about what is going on. It manages to be full of emotion, drama and even suspense as the characters "fight" to overcome their respective condition.The movie manages to maintain a good line of unpredictability. It's non-linear nature makes it a very good example of how to make such a film, being able to generate plenty of eye goodness through its plot, characters but also wonderful acting, certainly deserving its very high rating.

title: A great college movie.
content: Good Will hunting is a good film with an impeccable script by Matt Damon and Ben Affleck. Robin Williams is great as the tutor and won the best supporting actor for the role. Gus Van Sant has a great track record and he is very good here. If you like strong hard hitting films with a lesson than you cannot go wrong with Good Will Hunting.

title: Not That Good But Not That Bad
content: "I'm glad that i watch Dead Poets Society first then this, because if we talk about Robin Williams perfomance as a man that smart and can change people's mind i'm still prefer Dead Poets Society, i just not a big fan of this movie, all the perfomance including Matt Damon himself is ok except Robin Williams, there are several perfomance that i don't really like and of them is Ben Affleck, i just hate it, i think his perfomance is very lacking in here, but i think him and Matt Damon do a really good job at the writing, overall Good Will Hunting unfortunately Not That Good but Not That Bad"

title: A Very Touching Emotional Movie
content: Since the first few seconds into the movie, i can even already tell that this is going to be a wonderful cinematic masterpiece. They really did great with all the setting, cinematography, color tone, and basically the whole visuals for this movie.I really love the script. Every lines--especially which said by Will and Sean--always left me kind of strange and awestruck feeling. They builds the whole emotion throughout the film extremely clever and this is one of the movie with the greatest acting performance i've ever seen. I've never seen anything more touching than seeing two actors interact very intimate to each other.This is about a very much intellegent boy with a traumatic past which leds him to a point where he didn't want to open up and let anyone else close to him aside his friend. He keep denies his own unreal intelligent until one day he met someone who being able to help him find his way in life.Definately a gold classic. I don't know anymore how to explain what this movie has made me feel. It seems like i can't find the right word to describe such a piece of art like this.

title: Well crafted film that essentially glorifies white-trash.
content: Well acted and written film.  However, it follows in a long tradition in Western culture of romanticizing white-trash.  The recipe is usually the same.  Take a working class loser, make him very handsome, brave, charming, and extremely intelligent, then contrast him against well educated people who are shown to be sexually frustrated, neurotic, and otherwise unhappy, and you create a white-trash hero.  "Good Will Hunting" plays this game very effectively.  By the end of the film it has you believing the classic lie that education is unnecessary and all that matters in life is that you get the girl.  Still, a good film at what it tries to do.  However, one should watch an episode of Jerry Springer after seeing this film to remember what uneducated white-trash are really like.

title: Like maple syrup
content: Sappy.I liked how they went to the "Haaavaad baaa" to quote books at each other to impress the ugliest girl there.Probably the janitor at my school is a genius too but is waiting to land that big construction job.Just because you keep your nose to the grindstone is no reason to try to cut a steak with it. "Do you like apples?"the guy nods or something."Well, how'd ya like DEM APPLES!" Wow, that IS genius.Duh, Minnie Driver would give her number to anybody. Robin Williams can't paint and keeps the good books on the top shelf. And there's a professor who always wears a priest scarf for no reason.

title: It's almost 2020 and this film was so ahead of its time
content: I have never written a review before. I have rated a great many films and TV series but there was one scene in this film that so profoundly affected me, that I had to comment about it. Now I have watched this film several times since it was made and really enjoyed it, but today 12/30/19, I had to comment on this one particular scene in the movie. The scene is when Will is meeting with the NSA guy, regarding why he should join the clandestine agency. First may I say, how ahead of its time Will's explanation is, as to why he should not join the NSA. It is prior 911 and prior to any current scrutiny of these agencies. Will's response to why he shouldn't join the organization is unbelievably prophetic, considering it was written 22 years ago. His explanation of why he shouldn't, should make every proud citizen struggling to survive, question the current standards and practices of our government agencies including and especially our president's. Will's response explains the actions of the agency and its consequences to the average american citizen. So if you are a reasonable adult, who values morality and is now questioning or possibly doubting our current government agencies, politicians and our presidenct due to questionable tactics and policies, please watch this scene in the movie. Just do so with an open heart and mind. PS, by the way I highly recommend you watch the entire movie as it an incredible and enjoyable watch but that scene is like a crystal ball into our current future. I am really extremely impressed by Matt and Ben's work and vision.

title: Best movie I've ever watched. It's a master piece.
content: Performance delivery that does the thoroughly-planned and meticulous screen writing justice. The narrative captures the struggles of morality, relationships and mental health, as the movie follows the development of an inert young man. An amazing exploration of society's demands and their effects on how we view people to shape the world. A must see.

title: Perfect (For Me)
content: First saw this film when I was a freshman in college. It was the first time in my life where a movie finished, and I felt something. Of course I had uncountable movies prior to GWH that I loved, but this one was special. Personally think that had to do with where I was at in life, and the source material was extremely relatable.As I aged into adulthood, this movie kept me coming back. I remember the first time showing my wife (while we were dating). Constantly recommending it to anyone who says they haven't seen it. There are numerous reviews here saying how overrated it is.... Just don't see it. Personally cannot find a flaw.All of it is fantastic, but I have to give special props to the scene where Robin Williams explains the Boston Red Sox game that he *didnt* go to. Perfect. I'd argue an 11/10, perfect, moving, powerful.If you're like me and love this film, do yourself a favor and YouTube search Matt Damon and Ben Afflecks acceptance speech at the Oscars. Little know fact- the script started as Matt Damon's final project in a college class.A well deserved 10/10. Classic. Timeless.

title: psychology
content: Really good and heart touching story, i think this was a really good movie for back then when psychology wasnt getting any attention and care it needs to be given. Childhood affects the people so much, such a good example of it we see in wills actions and behaviour. Take care of yourselves and your loved ones everybody.

title: The girl Lamot is talking to out side the first psychologist's office
content: OK, I have to know who the girl is sitting on the floor listening to the prof talking about how beautiful a mathematical proof can be and she goes "Wow!" Every time I see her I go "Wow" too, and you can only see her profile.Who is that stunning long-legged blonde goddess? If those lines really can pull birds like that then I wanna be a maths geek too. She must be mine!So if anyone has her name or her number or email or home address, I'm pretty sure she's waiting for me to get in touch, so do us a favour.After all, it's always possible that she's not really after a maths professor but is really saving herself for a broke Australian high school teacher.cheersAndy xPS No one ruin my fantasy, OK?

title: What do geniuses say?
content: Good story, excellent acting - especially by Matt Damon, really outdistancing all the others - and an awakener of many thoughts. Just one thing: what do geniuses say, really?A script writer might need to be one, too, to get it right. This film leans heavily on learning, instead of wisdom, on wits instead of brilliance, on truisms instead of innovative perspectives. The actors do a great job in hiding this flaw, but there it is.The nature of the genius has been explored since the romanticism of the early 19th century - I'm not sure the idea of such blessed humans was even around, before that. Maybe such people exist, and maybe not. In most cases, they have very specialized talents. Some have perfect memory, others excel at math. That does in no way make them better equipped for rhetoric or social skills. Thus, a genius can be a real idiot, outside that special field of competence.Let's say that two brilliant persons sit down and have a very enlightened conversation with each other. What do they say? How much do they have to say? And will we, the audience, at all understand? Afore such uncertainties, succumbing to a love story finale seems to be the safe way out. But that's no stroke of genius.

title: Life altering experience
content:
This is by far the best movie I have or will ever see. It has changed my outlook on life and has led me to see things from a different perspective. Thank you Matt Damon and Ben Affleck for such a wonderfully insightful script. And to those who think Robin Williams gets typecasted as a comedian, please watch this movie. One of the best performances I have ever seen. Hats off!
Must have seen it over 50 times.

title: Way, Way, WAY Overrated, Maudlin, Schlocky Fairy Tale
content: It's a somewhat watchable film only for Matt Damon's above average understated performance and Robin Williams' usual quality work, but the emotionally manipulative story is just too overwrought and self indulgent to warrant my admiration.A mathematical super-genius who chooses to clean toilets is such a nearly impossible, outlandish premise, but we're expected to swallow it hook line and sinker. Am I supposed to relate to the poor misunderstood prodigy with the humble, blue collar heritage? This is just a typical Hollywood Cinderella fantasy relocated to Academia with some heartrending pablum tossed in for the ladies. Delusional, nonsensical melodrama that deigns to present itself as insightful and profound, but it really isn't. It's mostly contrived and tedious.

title: Heartwarming
content: Good Will Hunting is a heartwarming tale of a troubled genius, Will Hunting (Matt Damon), who finds himself at a crossroads. His exceptional mathematical abilities are discovered by a renowned professor, but his rebellious nature and past trauma hinder his potential. Enter Sean Maguire (Robin Williams), a therapist who challenges Will's defenses and helps him confront his demons. The film's raw dialogue, powerful performances, and exploration of themes like self-discovery and redemption make it a timeless classic. While the ending may be predictable, the journey is filled with poignant moments and unforgettable characters.

title: Best movie of all time
content: One of the best movies of all time. I always find myself forgetting this movie exists and i go back to watch it and even though i know whats gonna happen i find myself crying in the exact same scenes. Its so real and relatable. As sad it is you crack a smile a couple times and shed a tear just as much. The acting is amazing, its like your actually watching this happen in real time to real people. You feel the emotions through the screen and its liberating. Its one of those movies u can binge watch many times and never get bored of. Love this movie definitely recommend. If u love movies about mental health or rom-coms this is the movie for you. If u love both, even better, ur guaranteed to love this movie. It's the kind of movie that stays with u and u go back to a million times.

title: Top notch movie
content: This is by far the best movie I've everRobin Williams was born for roles like this. Just like in Dead Poets Society and Awakenings, he delivers a performance that feels deeply personal, almost as if the role was written just for him. He brings such warmth, wisdom, and quiet power that every scene he's in becomes unforgettable. The way he plays Sean Maguire-with patience, understanding, and a touch of sorrow-makes him the heart of the movie. His monologue about his wife, the "it's not your fault" scene, and even the way he just sits in silence with Will all feel incredibly real. Williams doesn't just act-he feels like the mentor every lost soul wishes they had.But this movie wouldn't be what it is without Matt Damon. His portrayal of Will Hunting is so raw and convincing that it's hard to believe this was his breakthrough role. The way he captures Will's intellect, arrogance, humor, and deep emotional wounds makes him an incredibly layered character. From the first scene, where he's solving complex math problems with ease, to the moments of rage and self-sabotage, Damon makes Will feel like a real person. One of his strongest moments is the confrontation with Robin Williams' character, where he mocks Sean's painting and tries to push him away, only to be completely disarmed when Sean flips the script on him. The way Damon's expressions shift from confidence to discomfort to vulnerability in that scene is brilliant.The film does an incredible job of showing what it's like for someone who comes from nothing yet possesses extraordinary talent. Will is a genius, but he's also a product of an abusive past, foster homes, and a world that never gave him a reason to believe in himself beyond his intellect. The script (written by Damon and Ben Affleck) brilliantly captures how intelligence alone isn't enough-growth, healing, and self-worth come from human connection. That's where Sean, and to some extent Chuckie (Affleck's character), come in.Chuckie, Will's best friend, might seem like just another Boston tough guy, but he's actually one of the most important figures in Will's life. The moment where he tells Will that the best part of his day is the few seconds where he hopes Will won't be there-that he hopes Will will have left for something better-is one of the film's most powerful scenes. It's a rare depiction of tough love that isn't cruel but deeply caring.The romance between Will and Skylar (Minnie Driver) also adds another layer to the story. Their relationship is sweet, playful, and real, but it also highlights Will's biggest flaw-his inability to trust or let people in. His decision to push her away rather than risk getting hurt is one of the most heartbreaking parts of the film. It takes Sean's relentless patience and understanding to break through to him, showing him that while pain is inevitable, running from it only makes it worse.In the end, Good Will Hunting isn't just about a gifted young man discovering his potential-it's about breaking cycles, facing fears, and realizing that intelligence means nothing if you don't allow yourself to truly live. The performances, the writing, and the deeply human themes make this one of the best films ever made.

title: From Bottom to Top
content: I see a movie with Matt Damon and Ben Affleck and I tend to drift away from it but this film was different. Matt and Ben tend to be dry, boring actors and never tend to be in very interesting films. They fit into the characters so well you would think they were actually real people. Although I never really enjoy movies with either of these actors I thought this film was very well done. I give it a 10/10! A film of brilliance, heartbreak, rebellion, and a wild adventure. Knowing that they directed this movie I thought the plot would be awful but it really captured the essence of human nature. Matt and Ben really got into character and captured the true personality of two boys from 1980"s South Boston. From roaming the streets, bar fights, to the accents and the culture.Will is a young boy at the bottom of the social pyramid who has lived a lonely, abusive life. He works as a janitor at MIT but is yet extremely intelligent and begins solving their problems that not even the professors could do. Because of his lifestyle and who he is it's not okay for him to express his intelligents to society.This film tells a story that is quite common yet is hidden from the world. Will (Matt) is highly intelligent yet he never puts it to use. People continue to push him to move forward and use his abilities yet he chooses not to. He's at the bottom of the social pyramid but has the ability to be at the top. People read into him and he feels threatened by that so he tries to outsmart them by reading deeper into them tearing them apart. Just like any movie there is always a girl but it isn't all lovey dovey. This movie captures the struggle of love in which he struggles with from his early childhood. Will picks up a girl at the bar and they talk and grow closer until she falls in love with him. She tries to push him to do something with his abilities and be a part of his life but that scares him so he tells her he doesn't love her even though he truly does. He fears being loved and hurting her.This movie really deals about vulnerability, fear, friendship, and of course love. Will feels vulnerable being loved by a woman. A relationship would make him have to open up in which he fears because he feels as if he doesn't deserve love. He fears the judgement. Robin shows how powerful love really is by talking about his wife whom even though is dead he constantly cherishes their moments together and shares them, his life still revolves around her, he expresses happiness then and now. Will is scared to share his potential with the world because he doesn't know what that might bring upon him and others. He's scared to see how society will view him. He enjoys his abilities but is fearful to put them into the world. Will's therapist whom is Robin Williams tries to read into Will in which Will begins to try and stab at him and this continues for multiple sessions and some sessions are just silent with no talking. Robin waits for Will to make the first move of speaking because he's not going to solve his problems for him. The most simple stories lead to the most valuable advice in which Will slowly starts to accept and they form a friendship. Eventually Will goes and gets the girl, he opens up and brings himself out there, he wants happiness and love. He started at the bottom and slowly climbs his way to the top.Overall, this movie is very well done. It's like a psych lesson. This movie is relate able to real life because there are many people out there just like Will and yet we turn a blind eye to them and they never get to express their true potential. The movies ends unknowingly just like real life, we never know where we will end up we can only imagine what will happen to us next and proceed to take those steps. It captures the human nature that we are too afraid to bring ourselves too. Highly interesting, charismatic, brilliant, rebelling film.

title: inspiring
content: This film is a 10/10, it revealed to me that being vulnerable and communicating with others is needed to over come our traumas. Will expresses intelligence instead of vulnerability throughout the film so he doesn't have to confront his emotions. Sean was one person who helped Will shed the layers of built up traumas that were holding him back from his true potential. The end of the Film was satisfying knowing that Will makes a move out of true love.

title: Inspiring
content:
358/5000
This movie makes us think well in our future.
We can have the facilities and not use them correctly, even if it seems the best for everyone else.
We have to focus on something that makes us feel happy and complete. For we can, under any circumstances, use them to our advantage.
So that's what I learned from Will and the psychologist.

title: Beautiful, funny and interesting
content: This story gives us insight on the relationship of a young, problematic genius. I feel like this movie has an amazing dialogue, sublime actors and a gripping storyline, in fewer words, I don't see any flaws in it.This movie always makes me and my dad cry, and he's not a very emotional person, so this says a whole lot about the emotional charge this movie brings to the spectator.I believe it to be one of the best movies ever, because it stands out. Perhaps not given to genius directing, but because of emotions capturing the audience's attention and, most importantly, their hearts.They are able to do all of this while still maintaining their lines funny, light and witty. It's something I've learned to appreciate, this kind of humour. Maybe not the Adam Sandler type, so obvious, but more of a combination of clever and witty comebacks or lines that you notice throughout the movie.Loved it.

title: Living Genius Society
content: A case where Hollywood lucks out and 2 young writers/actors come along and create a masterful script that tricks Robin Williams to do a sequel to Dead Poets Society. Not literally, but the story's formula and function of Robin's DPS character remain the same. Calculus replaces poetry with a hint of matrices to come.Outside of setting and soundtrack mistakes of Gus Van Sant's mid-life crisis and 1970s revelry that makes this film seem a decade older than his classic My Own Private Idaho (1991), the first half is genius. Then, he and Robin Williams turn it into more of a seize the girl, love-will-save-you cliché than an outside-the-matrix, seize your genius modern-day intellectual fantasy.Despite the probably unintentional attempts to subvert it and the annoying product placement that had taken over Hollywood, the story is an adult male intellectual/geek fantasy. Even the gals are telling dirty jokes about alternative uses for their mouths.

title: One of the worst
content: Um... Maybe I just didn't get it... but everyone thinks i am a freak with no soul because i hated this movie...I will tell you why i hated it...First off, i began to literally fall asleep in the middle of the movie because this movie was very very boring. The story absolutely sucked. I don't see how these guys won a best screenplay for this. The dialogue was painfully forced and unrealistic--am I supposed to laugh at the "how do you like them apples line".. am i supposed to feel a sense of accomplishment for the character? Instead with that line, and in fact that whole scene and the rest of the movie had me saying "WTF?????"Not to mention that scene in the bar again, but who has conversations at a bar like that? Not even Harvard attendees talk like that at a bar--they are busy doing keg stands and playing beer pong.Where were the basic elements of a good story in this? Rising action--climax--falling action--character development--protagonist--antagonist. Is anyone with me on this...Or am I alone in the world?

title: Well Deserved Oscars for Williams, Damon and Affleck
content: One of the benefits of "Secret Movie Night" is that it forces me to watch (or rewatch) a film that I would not seek out on my own. Such is the case with this month's selection - GOOD WILL HUNTING - the film that made Matt Damon and Ben Affleck stars and earned the late, great Robin Williams his only Academy Award.Leaning hard on the mantra "write what you know", GOOD WILL HUNTING tells the tale of a generationally talented math prodigy, who grew up in South Boston and fights his demons to find his place in this world.Famously, the screenplay of this film earned Damon and Affleck Oscars for Best Original Screenplay and it is well deserved. They paint a picture of life of these "Southies" that appears to me real and genuine. The "family" feel of the friendship of the main characters rings true and Damon and Affleck have real chemistry with each other - like old friends playing off each other.However, the relationship between Affleck and Damon's character in this film is only the 3rd best relationship in this film. The best, of course, is the relationship between Will Hunting (Damon) and the shrink that is assigned to him, played by Robin Williams. It is a haunting, raw, emotional and REAL performance by Williams - one very deserving of the Oscar - and I was more than a little sad to watch this performance knowing that this uniquely talented performer is no longer with us.The surprise to me in this rewatch of the film is the performance of Minnie Driver as a young lady that becomes emotionally attached to Will. Driver's performance as Harvard student Skylar is also real and the struggles of her character to get a connection with Will was heartbreaking to watch.Good Will Hunting also features strong supporting work by Stellan Skarsgard as the MIT Math Professor who discovers - and then becomes jealous of - Will's talents and Ben Affleck's younger brother, a then unknown Casey Affleck, who steals almost every scene he is in.All of this would not have worked without the magnificent, Oscar nominated, Direction of Gus Van Sant (DRUGSTORE COWBOY). He was the perfect choice to direct this intimate, personal drama and he has a way of drawing out the emotions and rawness of the characters on the screen without being cloying or overdramatic. He was a strong contender for Best Director that year (as was Good Will Hunting for Best Picture) but it ran into a roadblock that was James Cameron and TITANIC.If you have never seen this film - or if you haven't seen this in quite some time - check out GOOD WILL HUNTING, it is well worth your time.Letter Grade: A9 stars (out of 10) and you can take that to the Bank(ofMarquis)

title: A Masterpiece in Character Study. A Symbol of the Things We Forgot as a Society
content: As of 2023, the year in which this review is being written, we have forgotten that these types of movie were the ones at the height of mainstream cinema.Nowadays, we are accustomed to big budget movies that focus too much on how they show images on a screen rather than what they are trying to tell us through those images. That has led us to a weird moment in the movie making industry. The centerpiece of current movies are these big actor and actresses that have become a sort of cultural pillar of the industry. Making them seem "higher than life" and do incredible things on the screen is the most important thing, the story that is being told plays second fiddle to that.So to watch a movie like Good Will Hunting is a huge breath of fresh air. We can relate to every single character in the movie, at some point or another, and the magic happens precisely because of it.From a genius young man with a dark past, to an academic mastermind in the math field, to a student who struggles to balance her academic and personal lives, to a promising psychologist that has given up on life due to the lost of the love of his life, it is uncanny how they are all so different, and yet so relatable. As the movie moves on, and we start to peel the layers of these characters, we get to truly know them and see how they struggle with feelings that we wall have. We see how these feelings affects their lives, as different from our as they might be.At that point, all these characters get together to tell us a wonderful story that is universal and can resonate with each and every one of us.The movie was impeccably written by the newcomers (at the time) Matt Damon and Ben Affleck, who also showed incredible acting skills. The combination of Matt Damon and Rachel Majorowski (who unfortunately we never saw again in the mainstream) gave us some really touching and deep moments. Casey Affleck, Ben Affleck's brother and one of my favorite actors, was already showing the depth of his acting. And needless to say that Robin Williams, one of the all-time greats, brought heart and soul to the movie with his perfectly balanced acting complemented by the always reliable Stellan Skarsgård.The writing is simple, but effective in its character study and clever on how it makes us connect to the characters and feel their vulnerabilities not a sign of weakness, but strength and bravery. Vulnerability that was lost to us a society, in an age where everyone tries to be as invincible and powerful as the "super characters" we see on the current movie screen.Sometimes, we don't need to save the world or change the political landscape of society. Sometimes we need to fight the battles within and understand that the biggest winnings are done by connecting with others and accepting our vulnerabilities. Only then can we move on to a better place in our lives.

title: good will hunting
content: So, if I asked you about art, you'd probably give me the skinny of Every art book ever written. Michelangelo. You know a lot about him: life's work, political aspirations, him and the Pope, sexual orientation, the whole works, right? But I bet you can't tell me what it smells like in the Sistine Chapel. You've never actually stood there and looked up at the beautiful ceiling, seen that.

title: A masterpiece in storytelling
content: Even though this film is a slow burner and usually I don't enjoy these type of films as I have a heard time engaging with them I have to say this film was something. The slow burner was purposefully done. The film has a great and interesting storyline and to top that a well written and intelligent script. This is probably one of the strong assets to this film because even though it's slow, it's gripping and engaging I honestly didn't even see the two hours passing. I also have to say Gus Van Sant did a really good job directing this film. Another strong point about this film is probably the acting. Matt Damon and Robin Williams gave amazing and solid performances and were really convincing. I even cried at the end of the film just goes to show how moving this film was. Its a 10/10 for me.

title: Yeah, it's a great film
content: I have a reason why I didn't rate this movie a perfect 10. First, let me say that I actually liked "Good Will Hunting": solid performances, fantastic direction, stylish cinematography, and a brilliant film score by Danny Elfman. At the same time, there was something in the film that I found somewhat imperfect: the script. I mean, the plot itself was well-put together (although it felt often overdramatized with lots of sentimentality), but the dialogues were not always realistic... as sometimes the characters spoke kinda weird - for example, a conversation between Robin Williams and Stellan Skarsgård (two excellent actors) sounded strange and it felt like they were just reading their lines to each other, a dialogue with hundreds of swearwords in it... and the characters in such scenes did not seem that multi-dimensional. Anyway, like I said, the movie itself is good and overall I liked it, although there were indeed some flawed dialogues and scenes in the script, and the characters were not always that convincing. Still, worth a look.

title: Robin Williams' Best
content: "Good Will Hunting" was the feel good movie of 1997, but it was Robin Williams (in an Oscar-winning role) showing his true ability as an actor that made the film work.  The film deals with a troubled young janitor at MIT named Will Hunting (Matt Damon in an Oscar-nominated performance) who is a mathematical genius in spite of his minimal education.  "Good Will Hunting" is a combination of "Rocky" and "Ordinary People" in the fact that you pull for the underdog (Matt Damon) and you see how psychologically scarred he is through the man who is acting as his psychiatrist (Robin Williams).  Is "Good Will Hunting" a great film?  No, but it's one of those films that you can't help but like due to the elements that are in it.  4.5 out of 5 stars.

title: Good
content: This film is a compelling journey that seamlessly blends storytelling, emotion, and visual artistry. From the opening scenes to the climactic finale, it keeps the audience engaged with a combination of powerful performances, a well-crafted narrative, and stunning visuals.The cast delivers exceptional performances, bringing depth and authenticity to their characters. Every actor, whether in a leading or supporting role, contributes meaningfully to the story, creating moments that resonate emotionally. The relationships between the characters feel genuine and are a key driving force behind the film's impact.The direction is masterful, showcasing a clear vision that balances intricate plotlines and emotional arcs. The pacing ensures that the story unfolds naturally, maintaining tension and intrigue without feeling rushed or drawn out. The cinematography is another standout element, capturing breathtaking visuals that enhance the atmosphere and immerse the audience in the world of the film.

title: Absolutely ingenious
content: I'm imagining that the people who call this film boring are of the frame of mind, that unless a film has at least three explosions then it's not worth the price of a cinema ticket. Then there are the people calling it unrealistic. Now forgive me but I come from a similar background to the central character Will and I believe myself to be intelligent, but I didn't use my intelligence until very recently. Instead I took to taking drugs and drinking and swearing! Only a few years ago I was working as a cleaner, but now I'm studying programming and media technology at the best technical University in the UK. Now if I can identify with this film's realism (and I live in England) why can't so many others? This film is a veritable jewel. The script is one of the best I've ever seen. The way it mixes thought provoking ideas and witticisms with the kind of colloquial dialogue which we have read in things like 'The Catcher in the Rye'. Now I agree with the sentiment that some people have put across, 'get in touch with your inner Robin Williams'. But thankfully the script or Gus Van Sant or whatever prevented it from going over board. Look at the final scene where they're hugging and saying their farewells. Now this could have overlapped into a typical slushy moment, but no the lines 'Doesn't this contravene the Doctor, patient relationship?' 'Only if you grab my ass' were uttered so as to diffuse it. Then bear in mind that you never actually see the reunion between Skylar and Will! I could go on forever arguing against people's criticisms. But what's the point if certain viewers can't appreciate the subtly evocative direction of Van Sant, the quick fire script and the superb performances by the cast. It's these same viewers who shall, until the end of their days sit and watch the vacuous outpourings of Hollywood mainstream. Let them watch this 'chewing gum for the mind' and we discerning few will lap up the droplets of quality cinema.

title: Please...
content: This movie is so predictable when you know the modern American dream: Do nothing, be a loser and then suddenly... whoah! You're a genius and an obnoxious one and the world is kissing the ground you are walking on.And surprisingly all the other smart people are losers. They don't know anything and are bitter when our wonderkid solves problems so easily. And what kind of problems? They are so difficult but still these professors can analyse the results in less than 10 seconds.Every movie has something good in it anyway and Robin Williams is it in this one.

title: I can't explain 🎄💔
content: What can I say... I can't describe the amount of feelings and feelings I had with this movie... It has become and will remain one of the most beautiful things I've seen in my life... This movie changed my outlook on life and made me look at life in another way and opened up horizons for me that I had never been focused on and that were of no interest to me .... A very wonderful movie, I enjoyed every second of this movie ... The performance of Mad Damon and Robin William was wonderful, the soundtrack was breathtaking, the whole world in its details was touching .... I liked the story and the way it was told, I liked the directing .... I did not feel this feeling With any movie before.... I cried.... I laughed.... I got angry.... I had all the emotions in this movie.... One of the movies that reminds me the most is that movies are not just graphic fiction but rather They are also feelings that can change a person's life and change his mentality... I loved the movie so much 🎄✨

title: A beautiful hunting of life
content:
Good Will Hunting is a poignant drama that explores themes of class, trauma, and the importance of emotional intelligence. Matt Damon delivers a captivating performance as Will Hunting, a janitor at MIT with a genius-level intellect but struggles with emotional baggage from childhood abuse. Robin Williams shines as his unconventional therapist, offering a blend of humor and tough love. The film's strength lies in its raw and honest portrayal of mental health struggles and the power of human connection. However, some may find the ending overly sentimental.Key Strengths:
* Authentic portrayal of mental health: The film tackles complex issues like trauma and emotional repression with sensitivity and realism.* Strong performances: Damon and Williams deliver powerful and nuanced performances that resonate deeply with audiences.* Thought-provoking themes: Good Will Hunting explores universal themes of love, loss, and finding one's place in the world.Potential Weakness:
* Sentimental ending: Some may find the resolution of Will's emotional journey overly idealistic and predictable.Overall, Good Will Hunting is a moving and impactful film that continues to resonate with audiences due to its honest portrayal of human struggles and the importance of finding connection and healing.

title: A great educational movie.
content: I really love Williams character as a teacher. And in good will hunting he seems a really inspirational character to me. The way he mentally cure Will is just amazing. On the other hand Will is great character too. He don't have a proper education but he still manage to do some critical math is just fascinating.

title: Great movie!
content: It's been a long time since a film truly resonated with me on this level. Good Will Hunting is an extraordinary cinematic achievement, and in my opinion, Gus Van Sant's masterpiece. While the pacing might seem deliberate and slow at times, I believe this was an intentional choice that significantly contributes to the film's emotional depth and psychological exploration.The deliberate slow burn allows us to fully immerse ourselves in the lives and internal struggles of the characters. We witness Will's raw genius, his emotional turmoil, and his hesitant steps towards healing. The film masterfully captures the nuances of human connection, the importance of mentorship, and the enduring power of self-discovery.The performances are exceptional, with Robin Williams delivering an Oscar-worthy portrayal of Sean Maguire, a therapist who challenges Will to confront his demons and embrace his potential. Matt Damon, as Will Hunting, is equally captivating, embodying the character's brilliance, rebelliousness, and underlying vulnerability with raw authenticity.Good Will Hunting is a film that stays with you long after the credits roll. It's a poignant and thought-provoking exploration of love, loss, and the human condition, reminding us of the importance of embracing our potential and finding the courage to heal.

title: A very good film, but with some flaws and problems that deserve attention.
content: This film is about a boy from Boston, who comes from very poor backgrounds, but who has a gift for mathematics, easily solving theorems and advanced problems that leave Harvard professors unanswered. He is discovered after solving one, at night and without telling anyone, and one of the professors at the university decides to help him be someone and make use of his gift. The problem is that he doesn't want to, he's not able to trust anyone, and he's seriously stuck with justice. Therefore, he will recruit an irreverent psychiatrist to try to help the boy.The film's premise is very good, and the story has merits that we cannot ignore or minimize. It's one of those delicious movies to watch, that leaves us without feeling the time that passes. We really know that guy is not a bad person, but it's not easy to like the character due to his options and his bad social attitude. However, what bothered me the most was the construction of Robin Williams' character and his whole way of acting and accompanying that patient. I think anyone who has ever had the need to see a psychiatrist knows that they have strict rules about what they can and cannot do, and Williams' character breaks a good number of them.And this leads us to talk about actors. I really enjoyed Williams' work, but he is a long way from the best that the actor has given us. Matt Damon also did a good job, perhaps one of the best of his career, and one that opened more doors for him in his professional life. Stellan Skarsgard also intelligently took advantage of the opportunity to impose himself on the American cinematic scene, with a job well done and of great merit. Minnie Driver also did an interesting job, perhaps even more so than Ben Affleck, whose character doesn't have as much visibility or relevance.Technically, the film has many merits, starting with the excellent cinematography, a good set of sets and interesting costumes. The effects are understated, but they work quite well, and the soundtrack also does a pretty good job. It is not, however, a film that stands out for its technical aspects, nor could it be. The important thing in this film is the story it brings us and the work of the cast.

title: Goody goody will be pretentious !
content: My brother rented this movie and told me to also check it out and after watching it, I had a bad aftertaste in my mouth.I felt that the plot is unbelievable, pretentious and the characters are, pheyew ! too goody, goody two shoes !
