(apart from the constant bad language)This is just another "feel-good-movie" trying to take people on a emotional ride which, after watching it, makes one doesn't feel anything but that the plot is trying hard to shove the emotional thing down one's throat.The screenwriters have forgot to add some sincerity into the show and puhleez! People can smell if the movie is sincere or just patronizing. Just take Dead Poets Society, I have seen the show years, years back and can still remember the story and some scenes from the show as it is memorable and I do care about the characters and how they feel.

title: The Importance of Not Being Too Earnest
content: This is just a movie, folks, not a case study.  As interested as I am in literary, historical, and sociological elements of dramatic films, I am put off by psychoanalysis or tortured deconstruction.What I liked about this one was Robin Williams' underplaying his role and Matt Damon's totally cold and rigid self-characterization -- apart from the conclusion, that is.  There is a good sense of Boston as well.The premise of the story is questionable as to any sense of consistent authenticity.  Antisocial behavior need not be a concomitant of genius, as other recent films about gifted but more or less detached characters seem to take for granted (as does this one).  Neither are saccharine catharses inevitable.  And the usually fine actor Stellan Skarsgard as the American professor with a French name and a Swedish accent seems miscast.  Ben Affleck plays Ben Affleck with a passion, not unusual in a sense but hardly commendable in terms of his overblown popular persona.  One wonders indeed how he figures in real life as putative co-author of this fairly decent screenplay.In short, there are some good moments and good lines -- and that is really what counts, even when the finished whole is less interesting or convincing than the finite parts.  Worth seeing.  7 of 10.

title: A touching journey of self-discovery
content: "Good Will Hunting," directed by Gus Van Sant, is a deeply moving drama that explores themes of genius, trauma, and the transformative power of human connection. The film follows Will Hunting, a janitor at MIT with an extraordinary gift for mathematics, as he navigates the complexities of his troubled life and untapped potential.Matt Damon delivers a compelling performance as Will, capturing the character's vulnerability and inner turmoil with authenticity. His portrayal is complemented by Robin Williams, who shines as Sean Maguire, a compassionate therapist with his own share of past pain. Their on-screen chemistry is palpable, creating some of the film's most poignant and memorable moments.The screenplay, written by Damon and Ben Affleck, is sharp and insightful, blending humor and raw emotion in a way that feels both genuine and impactful. The supporting cast, including Affleck as Will's loyal friend Chuckie, adds depth and warmth to the narrative."Good Will Hunting" is not just a film about intellectual brilliance; it's a heartfelt exploration of personal growth and the importance of facing one's fears. The film's emotional resonance and powerful performances make it a timeless story of redemption and the human spirit's resilience.

title: "Twenty years of counseling, I've seen some pretty awful sh*t. " - Sean
content: Everyone raved about 'Good Will Hunting' when it came out. At the time all I could do was roll my eyes and say, "Cmon. A movie written by Matt Damon and Ben Affleck. Yuck!". I finally got around to seeing it about a week ago, and I have to tell you I was pleasantly surprised. 'Good Will Hunting' isn't a great Oscar-worthy movie most critics pointed it out to be, but just a very good film with some good acting performances. Matt Damon in his finest acting performance yet plays Will. Will is considered a hoodlum by some and hangs out with his buddies led by Chuckie (Ben Affleck in a so-so performance, which is very good for him). They screw around, get drunk and beat people up -- they are real 'nothings' to society. But, Will has a secret -- he's a genius. He works as a janitor at Harvard University and one day solves a "said-to-be" impossible math problem put up by the brilliant Math professor (played by Stellan Skarsgaard in a strong performance). Will then becomes the math professor's new hero and is destined for greatness, but will Will abandon his friends to better his own life? Robin Williams steals the show in an electrifying performance as Will's psychiatrist and Minnie Driver provides good acting as Will's British Harvard girlfriend. Gus Van Sant's directing is fair and the writing is pretty solid for the most part (but nothing Academy Award worthy). The bottom line is that 'Good Will Hunting' is a very good film where the good points more then out-weigh the bad points, but it's nothing spectacular. I recommend it. Grade: B

title: Can you say "hype"?
content: I know for sure, that if Matt Damon and Ben Affleck had not been the ones credited with having wrote this film, nobody would have seen this film. Whats more, nobody would have cared. This is Hollywood at its "Indie" best. Trying to pretend that some of their hot properties can be artistic as well. The only problem is that this film is so painfully average and predictable, that few film festivals would have given it the time of day, had it not been for the writers. The story is an old one, just set in a bit of a different setting. Young tough, down on his luck, born poor, no future, gets opportunity and betters himself. Ahhh, what a "feel good" story. Please! I just love the scene in the bar where Will shows up the cocky Harvard kid on his knowledge of American History. Damon reels off one of the most laughable historical arguments in American History. The information is accurate, but the source is ludicrous. There is no way that his character could make such an argument, even if he had read the authors and understood them. He showed knowledge of the Harvard curriculum that even someone in the Liberal Arts Department would not know. It just strained credibility as this whole movie does. It was an average at best movie that was hyped into a masterpiece. I dismiss the Academy, because I know how the Hollywood Insider game is played. I mean, come on, Kim Bassinger and Mira Sorvino have an Academy! LOL! I mean, Beverly Hills Cop won for best screenplay, even though it had been passed around for five years. In reality, this film is ** out of ****. However, did you know that Matt and Ben wrote it? **** out of ****.

title: This movie stole my heart
content:
"Good Will Hunting" grew on me slowly as I watched it, had an urge to want to turn it off a couple of times while watching but it all came down to one simple truth - this movie is great.
It tells a story of a young man who doesn't know his place in life and wastes most of it drinking in a bar with friends, getting into fights occasionally and doing some crappy jobs. And literally no one would blame him for it, we've all been there. But one day a time comes along and it gives you people who challenge you to get out of your shell and find your path, help you become a better person. I think everyone needs something like this movie in his life to re-evaluate it and see it in the different light.
Ben Affleck and Matt Damon's script, although a bit predictable and immature, is almost perfect despite that. The story gives you everything you want from a movie, it gives you time to roll on your back with laughter and to cry your eyes out, gives you food to think and thoughts to hold on to. Robin Williams is brilliant, he's phenomenal, he's the best thing in this movie and his closing line - amazing. Took the words right out of my mouth. Matt Damon's performance is near perfection and one of the best in his career.
It's a wonderful, kind, touching and thought-provoking movie. I loved it and would totally give it another watch.

title: I was locked in this whole time
content: Tbh it lost me in the middle the pacing got a lil slow for a minute and I got lost but I got reeled back in very soon. So this movie was great it felt real like people had real relationships. Like people had lives outside of this movie and the acting was great. This is one of those movies I don't wanna talk up cause it's not for everyone and if I hype it for someone there gonna think it's bad because it doesn't live to expectations but that doesn't mean this movie isn't great. If you like quiter slower paced movies about relationships this is a great pick. It almost gave me death note vibes it's hard to talk about how good it is without spoiling and I don't want to cause this movies great so check it out.

title: Good deeds will Hunt you
content: Good will Hunting 1997 it is my number one movie just cant stop watching it i have watched it over ans over again since the last ten years. It is unpredictable movie i will give it ten stars because i think i am addicted to that movie. Its contant contains all charactors the teaching section and jokes. I started whacthing it from a tender age since i was fiveteen till now as a grown up old man just cant stop whatching it. Good deeds will hunt you like in the movie good deeds pays off at the end. Try the movie guys you will see what i am sayin its true.give it a try as for me i will give it ten stars.

title: Brilliant but Broken: A Masterpiece of Self-Discovery
content: Good Will Hunting is a film that masterfully blends deep human drama, intellectual intrigue, and outstanding performances. The story of a brilliant but emotionally closed-off young man, who hides his fears behind defiance, captivates from the very first moments and holds your attention until the end.The greatest strength of the film lies in its characters. Matt Damon's portrayal of Will is raw and layered, making his pain and rebellion feel incredibly real. However, the standout performance belongs to Robin Williams as therapist Sean Maguire. His monologues, especially the powerful "It's not your fault" scene, are deeply moving and easily rank among the most emotionally charged moments in cinema.The film thoughtfully explores themes of past trauma, fear of the future, and the struggle for self-acceptance. There's no forced moralizing-just an honest, beautifully told story about how difficult it is to face oneself and stop running from life.If there's one aspect that could have been slightly improved, it's the development of Will and Skylar's relationship. While important to the story, it feels somewhat overshadowed by the central therapy arc.Overall, this is a film that doesn't just entertain but leaves a lasting impact. You walk away feeling changed-and that kind of cinema is rare.

Wow, what a film. This is what cinema is all about, a pure masterclass in storytelling, acting, and emotion. Good Will Hunting is an incredibly acclaimed movie for a reason, delivering a plot that couldn't have been done better. It pulls you in effortlessly with its natural banter and dialogue, making every interaction feel real. Within ten minutes, you're hooked. The way Will's intelligence is revealed is so satisfying: first as an anonymous janitor solving impossible equations, then as a kid in court, recklessly defending himself with sharp wit. The story unfolds in a way that keeps you engaged without ever feeling forced, balancing Will's genius with his emotional struggles and the relationships that shape him.And the performances? Wow. Matt Damon completely disappears into the role, making Will's pain, arrogance, and vulnerability feel heartbreakingly real. Robin Williams delivers an unforgettable performance, bringing warmth and quiet intensity to every scene he's in. Even Ben Affleck's character, though seemingly minor, carries weight, his lines adding real depth to the friendship. He delivered a proper performance, with lines you just can't forget. The bond between the group feels effortless, every conversation so well-written that it almost seems unscripted. And speaking of the script, Damon and Affleck wrote this. Absolute insanity. To have such a degree of talent in acting but simultaneously be incredible at writing, just wow. The dialogue is layered, memorable, and packed with quotes that linger long after the credits roll. Even if the opening credits are a drag, the film is simply brilliant, truly a life-changing movie.

title: Um, hello, to everyone who did not like this movie..what's not to like about it??
content: Matt Damon and Ben Affleck deserve our utmost sincerity and appreciation for writing a brilliant script. Robin Williams gives one of the best performances of his career! Matt & Ben were well deserving of their Oscar for the script , as was Robin for his supporting award. This movie should have gotten more Oscars than it did. Watching Will and how hard his life has been was a real eye opener for me, I realized how much he and I had in common. Matt Damon playing this role allowed me to view my own life and allow me to forgive some people. So, thank you Matt for your inspirational role. Minnie Driver was brilliant as well in her role, she was way better than Kim Basinger , and she should have gotten the Oscar. Bravo to everyone involved in this film! Absolutely brilliant in every way...

title: A maths genius who is discovered whilst working in a university as a cleaner. Story follows his struggle with his past, present and future.
content: Matt Damon and Robin Williams were both excellent in this film, however the presence of Mini Driver is irritating! If bad language either bothers or offends you, then don't watch this film, it is full of it. Quite touching at moments, but it is predictable.

title: Good Will Hunting Stands as a Model on How to do a Low-Budget Film Right
content: Good Will Hunting's plot follows troubled custodian Will Hunting (Matt Damon) as he tries to navigate relationships and life in 1997 Boston and Cambridge. Throughout the 126 minute film, Will's ego and psyche are challenged by the weathered Sean Maguire (Robin Williams) while finding something inside of himself he did not know he had with Skylar (Minnie Driver). This excellent and complex plot coupled with the outstanding music from the late Elliot Smith create an unforgettable atmosphere from start to finish.The screenplay finds a precise balance between distress and happiness which gives the film a unique footprint for future scripts to follow. The script is penned by Matt Damon and Ben Affleck, who also has a role in the film. During the writing stage of the production Gus Van Sant- the director of the film- visited Damon and Affleck frequently and later critiqued their writing method in the Introduction to the published screenplay: "Ben and Matt would fly into action and create something almost spontaneously with Matt standing in the middle of the hotel room demonstratively gesturing and editing ideas by drawing dotted lines in the air with his hands, with Ben writing down dialogue on his laptop computer." This spontaneous yet structured dialogue can be seen throughout the film, excellently mastered by the acting chops of Robin Williams and film royalty Stellan Skarsgård.Robin Williams delivers a more controlled and stable character as opposed to his mostly zany and comical repertoire. His character arguably grows as much as the main protagonist throughout the film as he needs to open up in order to mentor Will Hunting. In the famous "pond scene" Williams delivers- in my opinion- one of the greatest film monologues of all time, creating a father-figure character in less than five minutes. However, Williams does not waste a chance to shine in comedy during a completely improvised scene about two thirds through the film.Independent films today have grown to focus more on art than narrative, which lowers the quality of the film. When there is little-to-no narrative in your film, there is nothing for your audience to connect with. An example of this problem in more modern cinema is the film The Mountain Between Us. While the film captures awe-inspiring landscapes, the dialogue and narrative is so poor it is hard to feel any sort of connection with the characters whatsoever. For reasons and examples like these, this is why I believe that Good Will Hunting stands as a model on how to do a low-budget film right.

title: Abundance of interesting characters in a polished film
content: I was very surprised at the variety and depth of the characters in the GWH script. (This is after all a Hollywood movie.) Several of them (Robin Williams, Minnie Driver and Affleck and his friends) could have been the center of their own movies.Also it is rare when a brat pack type of film does a good job handling adult issues, as was done with William's and Skarsgard's characters coming to terms with what is success, commitment as well as pride and jealousy.The therapist client relationship which can be so off base to be a joke as in the "Prince of Tides" had a semblance of reality to it. The intense issue of child abuse was dealt with very briefly but in a fairly honest way.In a sense the story about the Matt Damon character being very bright was not that interesting to me. What I responded to were these characters trying to reach out and connect. This is overall a very polished package by the film makers, including fine acting - making GWH a positive experience.

title: To tell the truth, I thought it was boring
content: I sat down through 2 hours of pure boredom. I look here on IMDB, even though it is not high on the list, it is in the top 250. I was a little surpised. Even though, yes. I am very impressed with Robin and Matt's acting abilities, they still didn't save the movie. I'm not sure what I really didn't like about the movie. Maybe it's because I dispise math. Maybe I'm not too much for dreary talking for 2 hours. Even though I loved "American Beauty", but that was it. I just want my 2 hours back. It was a big waste of my time. If I'm missing something in this movie, please E-mail me. I am curious why this is on the top 250. And don't say "Because it was a good movie".2/10

title: A Review: Good Will Hunting by Gus Van Sant
content: The Plot1997s Good Will Hunting by Gus Van Saint is an American drama story that follows a troubled unrecognized genius Will Hunting (Matt Damon) who works as a janitor at MIT. Will is ready to spend his days working a minimal wage job and drinking with his buddies on the weekend until he solves a complex math problem and gets the attention of Prof. Gerald Lambeau who decides to help Will achieve his full potential by solving math problems and getting his life back on track with the help of Dr. Sean Maguire (Robin Williams). Dr. Maguire acts as a therapist to Will, delving into his deepest fears and worries whilst confronting his own underlying issues in the process.ReviewAt first glance, Good Will Hunting seems like a very generic drama with a quite predictable plot, and it is, there is the unrealistically smart genius to whom we could never relate, who despite being so gifted, needs someone else to help him reach his potential. But what really sets this movie apart, is not the plot or crazy unpredictable characters, but the truly realistic and hard-hitting emotions this movie is able to recreate in the viewer's mind. All the characters undergo their own development arch instead of funneling all their screentime into developing only the protagonist, which makes the movie feel way less constricted. You can see the effect of one person directly and significantly impacting another, just like it would in the real world, and most of the time you can really relate and feel those emotions. But the moments where this movie truly shines are the therapy sessions between Will Hunting and Dr. Sean Maguire. They delve deep into the human psyche and emotions, not being afraid of confronting themselves and the viewer with some harsh truths. You can feel the connection they make during the runtime of the film, and Sean becomes almost a guiding father figure to Will. Of course, the character interactions are not the only strong suit of the film. The acting was truly superb, making you believe everything the characters are saying without a doubt. The synergy between Matt Damon and Robin Williams was immaculate.Conclusion and final thoughtsOverall Good Will Hunting is one incredible movie, achieving such emotional realism that is hard to find these days with all the mainstream blockbusters. It is not afraid to present the rather cruel reality of life, while still showing how to create truly meaningful connections and make you relate to almost all the characters in some way or another. I think this movie is a must-watch for any teenager/young adult.

title: An All Time Great
content: This is one of my top films and would recommend to anyone who hasn't had the chance to watch it already.The cast fits the films narrative perfectly. The storyline is extremely compelling while the character development engaging. I've watched this multiple times and keep on coming back to it, it's one of those films with great re-watchability as there always aspects to pick up on that you hadn't realised before.Considering the age of the film it still battles for great cinematography. The backdrops and settings are very put together perfectly illustrating the time the movie was filmed. Overall an absolute class film, receiving the only 10/10 on my roster of movies.

title: Inspiring
content: This movie is a drama about a young janitor, Will Hunting (Matt Damon) working at MIT who has an immense gift for for learning, but struggles to put it to good use as he tries to find purpose and drive in his life. This movie tells a coming of age story for the complex Will Hunting who is almost equal parts gifted and challenged. This film, a school assignment turned passion project of the co-writers and stars Matt Damon and Ben Affleck, managed to become a relatable (albeit sometimes unbelievable) experience in a person's struggle to find purpose and balance in their ever changing life.The beauty of this film is primarily achieved through both it's narrative and acting (most notably Robin Williams' timeless performance as the therapist, Dr. Sean Maguire) which both compliment each other really well to make the characters and story really come to life. Beyond that I didn't think the cinematography was anything revolutionary, but was definitely purposeful and well thought out. As an Elliott Smith fan already, I was thrilled to find Good Will Hunting's soundtrack be filled with his songs, featuring some of his most popular tracks, mostly from his famous album "Either/Or" with the addition of the song "Miss Misery" which he had written specifically for this film. I think Elliott's work fits in perfectly with Good Will Hunting's setting, and I think both mediums complemented each other extremely well, elevating the impact of both the film and the songs, as all good movie sound tracks should aim to do.Overall, I gave this movie a 8 out of 10 as it is not exactly flawless, such as in the writing of Will Hunting's portrayal on screen as a genius, it sort of comes off in a way that makes it feel like the writers had to make everyone else seem dumb in comparison, so that the audience could understand how smart this character is. It's just sort of off putting for the movie to treat this MIT math professor like he doesn't know anything. At the end of the day I'd recommend this film to anyone looking for a powerful and inspiring coming of age story with an impressive cast, great story and awesome soundtrack. Although the premise of a random janitor turning out to be secret genius who can have all the fortune he wants if he chooses to chase it, is a little bit unbelievable and arguably childish, I really don't think that in the end, it takes away from the overall impact this movie aims to deliver to it's audience. The way Good Will Hunting explores themes such as self exploration, love and friendship is impactful and slightly preachy but manages to not come off as pretentious or overly sappy. The relationships between characters in this movie are well developed, realistic and relatable to the point where one could easily put themselves in any character's shoes and understand how and why they feel the way that they do, and how that might impact the next character. A really beautiful story with an inspiring ending.

title: Excellent job from a couple of Hollywood newbies.
content:
Good Will Hunting has been acclaimed as one of the most inspirational, tear-jerking films of the late 90's. The script is extremely impressive considering that it came from two Hollywood no-names: Matt Damon and Ben Affleck (Well, they were back then anyways).Matt Damon and Ben Affleck did the impossible by delivering a great script while successfully acting in their first big time film. While watching this film, it is easy to tell how genuine the dialogue really is. The dialogue is then capitalized on by great acting from every actor in the film. Matt, Ben, Robin Williams, and the rest of the cast all hit home-runs with their on screen performance. It is easy for the audience to forget that they are watching actors.It's simple. Unique writing + realistic acting + inspiring story + good cinematography techniques = a darn good movie.
Good Will Hunting fulfills that equation easily.However, the movie does fall a bit short from doing what it could have done . Much of the writing, being focused on realism, did a little too good at its job. Often, we find the screen play diving a bit too deep into dialogue that has little to do with the plot. Sure, its okay to portray the characters and their personalities in their bar-to-bar shenanigans; however, it does not help the flow of emotion that the viewers in the audience need to feel.
Simply put, the film lacks balance. If the film had been a bit more efficient with its comical relief and had spent more time developing the emotion of the characters, big emotional moments in the film would have felt even bigger. It is important that a story line flows with balanced progressive emotion until it hits its apex scene. Good Will Hunting's story line simply lacks the flow as the emotional scenes are scattered between scenes of passive unrelated dialogue. This makes the big emotional moments feel a bit over-dramatic when they arrive.Other than that, this film's screen play his a winning lottery ticket (see what I did there?).Great movie. I would recommend. I watched this film edited to take out the100+ F-bombs and I still enjoyed it very much.

title: Inspiring Movie
content: At the heart of Good Will Hunting are its characters, each brilliantly portrayed and intricately layered. Matt Damon's portrayal of Will Hunting, a troubled but extraordinarily gifted young man, is nothing short of captivating. From the outset, we see Will as a janitor at MIT, a genius who can solve complex mathematical problems with ease but struggles with emotional scars from his past. Damon brings a complexity to Will that is both intellectual and deeply vulnerable, making him relatable and compelling.Equally impactful is Robin Williams' portrayal of Sean Maguire, Will's therapist. Williams' performance is a masterclass in empathy and emotional depth. Through Sean, we see a man who has experienced his own profound loss and struggles, yet finds a way to connect with Will on a level that transcends therapy. Their scenes together are poignant and transformative, revealing layers of emotional truth that resonate long after the film ends.

title: Respectable but overly sentimental
content: Strong, naturalistic performances and the story is solid. It also evokes a strong sense of location and community, obviously close to the writers heart. That said, I don't find I connect with this film; it's just a bit too jam packed with shmaltz for my taste. I can definitely see why it's well regarded though.

title: Unbearable !
content: 10 years ago I've watched it. And it gave me only pain ever since. Pure and clear, I hate this movie. Rather, what's here to love?! Let me tell you, the moment when (Robin Williams) was talking about his wife who farted till she waked herself up, the joke of the girl in the café about old people's sexual perversity, the stupid never-ending lecture about genius guys (which seems copied, as it is, from many books), all of that are little instances for how disgusting and boring this movie is. Actually, this is what lived from it with the poor me. And when it comes to its cast, then let me bleed with hate; (Ben Affleck) is underrated actor, he is, since he isn't hated enough! I just can't stand (Minnie Driver) as an actress. And (Matt Damon) is so cold and unconvincing in mostly all what he does. There is a good story there, but totally murdered by adolescent script and provocatively mute direction. Nothing is beautiful in this movie. And while it's supposed to be touchy, it totally isn't. Save the scene of (Affleck) talking about missing his friend, I didn't enjoy anything. Enough to say that after its ending, I blamed myself hardly for setting all through it, and after 10 years I still do. Without further ado, and to be incredibly objective; THIS MOVIE ISN'T FOR ME.

title: Standing the test of time.
content: I had my 15 yr old girls watch it with me last month. They loves it so much that they requested to see it again! Beautifully written and acted! Robin Williams' genius is elevating the story even further. Yiu must see this film if you haven't, and if you have,watch it again!

title: It was this movie......
content: I watched this one with dad. I was only 8 years old. It was more than a good movie, it was a lesson in life, love, hurt and pain. So much expression from such a young actor. Man did I cry a lot. Saw GWH over a dozen times now, and I still cry..."How do you like them apples". So perfect. I've used that one a few times....Then there was Mr. Robin Williams. What do you say about that performance...... xoxo Mr. Williams.

title: An Incredible Movie.
content: No movie comes even close to this. Easily on my top list.

title: good
content: Performances: Matt Damon and Robin Williams deliver standout performances, with Williams winning an Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor. The chemistry between Damon and Williams adds depth to their characters' emotional journeys.Screenplay: Written by Damon and Ben Affleck, the script is lauded for its sharp dialogue and heartfelt moments. The narrative skillfully blends intellectual challenges with personal growth.Direction and Cinematography: Van Sant's direction ensures a poignant and intimate portrayal of Will's struggles. The film's use of close-ups and muted tones enhances its emotional impact.Legacy: "Good Will Hunting" is celebrated for its powerful performances, thoughtful script, and exploration of human potential and resilience. It remains a beloved film for its inspiring message and strong character-driven storytelling.

title: 10/10 Would Reccomend
content:
Twenty-year-old Will Hunting of South Boston works as a janitor at MIT, despite him being a self-taught mathematical genius. He spends his free time drinking with his friends, Chuckie, Morgan, and Billy. After solving a difficult high-level math problem on a chalkboard in the hallways of MIT, his talent is discovered by Professor Lambeau, who decides to help Will reach his full potential. When Will gets in a fight and is arrested for attacking a police officer, Professor Lambeau takes a deal to get leniency for Will if he gets treatment from therapist Sean Maguire. Although the movie plunges into and addresses the emotions of each character, like the psychological trauma that Will experiences, it still manages to incorporate lots of humor. There are many instances where the witty banter and hilarious exchanges, especially between Will and his friends, cause the audience to immediately respond with a laugh.
 "Good Will Hunting" was written by Matt Damon and Ben Affleck, who portray the two best friends, Will and Chuckie. One might stipulate that the writing and on-screen connection between the two would be mediocre, considering that Damon and Affleck were just in college when they began writing the script and the fact that they were not the big named actors that they are now. But, because Damon and Affleck are actually childhood besties in really life, they make the friendship between Will and Chuckie (and even with Billy and Morgan) all the more authentic. Their friendship and loyalty towards each other is the glue that keeps the movie together; they accept each other for who they are. The already well established relationship between Damon and Affleck reinforces their performances, reminding the audience that family does not just come in one form. Damon and Affleck didn't just grow up as best friends, they also grew up on Boston, which is where the movie is set. The movie included many scenes that were actually shot in the city. For example, the famous scene where Sean has a heart-to-heart talk with Will at a park was actually shot at Boston Public Garden. The movie has had such an impact on audiences that the bench where the conversation took place became a memorial for Robin Williams after his passing.
 Not only is the bond between Will and Chuckie unmistakable, but also their character development throughout the movie. Usually, the main character in a movie is moving towards a goal and the audience is rooting for them along the way. But, in this film, that is not the case. Will Hunting is not someone who embraces his intellectual gift and, in fact, seems to be against accepting it at all. This sort-of creates a frustration in the audience which, in turn, makes them root for him even more since they want him to learn to embrace it. The movie may seem typical-about some genius kid-but it actually touches upon two very important topics. First off, it addresses the psychology of Will. The movie dives into the psychology of Will and how the psychological traumas from his past have affected him all the way to adulthood. Also, in the movie, Will is faced with a decision: to use his intellectual gift to its full potential, or to pursue love. Just like how Chuckie hopes for Will to be gone one day when he comes to pick him up, the audience wishes for Will to embrace his gift and reach his full potential. But, it isn't that simple for Will and he has to learn to follow his heart and what he thinks is best for him. This screenplay, written by Damon and Affleck was nominated and won an Academy Award, as well as a Golden Globe, for "Best Writing, Screenplay Written Directly for the Screen".
 Just by looking at the cast, you can tell that the acting is going to be top-notch. Every role in this movie was cast perfectly and the actors performances were always in-character. The chemistry between Minnie Driver (Skylar) and Matt Damon (Will) is undeniable. Even though Damon wasn't yet a big-named actor, his performance was powerful. Skylar and Will's interactions were effortless, making the audience root for them without the writers needing to keep all the focus on them throughout the movie. No one could play the role of Sean better than Robin Williams. The dialogue that he delivered in the Boston Public Garden became so famous and resonated with so many that, when he passed, the bench where he delivered it became a memorial for him. Robin Williams won an Academy Award for "Best Actor in a Supporting Role" for his wonderful performance as Will's therapist/mentor, Sean. The performances were incredibly powerful and believable, and definitely one of the biggest reasons why this movie was so successful and is so loved.
 Despite the frequent use of vulgar language and the predictability of the overarching plot, "Good Will Hunting" is still definitely worth a watch. Although the opening minutes of the movie are slow, the movie as a whole presents a refreshingly enjoyable story of a mathematical genius who is, unexpectedly, relatable as he struggles with the psychological trauma from his past as well as the task of finding his true purpose in life.

title: The worst IMDb 250 movies
content: Hollywood at its worst. I have seen almost all IMDb's Top 250 and this one incredibly was/is the worst movie I've seen in that list. When I found this movie in IMDb 250, i looked at the summary and actors which I've found it very weird, Matt Damon and Ben Afflect VS MIT and Math, very weird combination for me. well I gave it a try and I really want my time back! there is nothing new in this movie that you haven't seen before in related Hollywood movies. Acting is not bad well it's not good either. The story hasn't have any ups and downs, very loose and shallow. No connection happened between me and characters at any time. Contrary to story's emphasizing of Matt's intelligence, i couldn't relate to him...Well enough is enough, Bad is Bad. if you want to waste you time well you're good to go. but if you thinking of anything related to Beautiful Mind or anything like that, Don't think of it! I give it 5/10 not 1/10 cause except the bad story and shallow acting it is a damn Hollywood movie!

title: We all need a little guidance
content: After a second viewing of this film, I give it a solid 8. Open yourself and be vulnerable before you watch this film, and it will humble you.We all need a little guidance in our lives, and we might not know as much as we think we do about the lives of others. This is just one of the many lessons this movie shares.

title: Excellent
content: What a great story and the only acceptable ending! Well done.

title: Masterpiece
content:
Wow. What a beautiful film.I knew it was good due to its iconic lines, stacked cast and emotive outline, however I never got round to watching it, but oh my.Haven't been so drawn and indulged throughout a film in a long time. My eyes were glued to the screen ensuring that I caught every word every character spoke.The journey this film puts you on was simply magical.The acting is sublime, the dialogue is clever, witty, emotive, touching, everything you'd want in a film.Simply could not recommend this film
enough.Not much more I can say besides from please watch.Can't wait for when I forget elements of this film so I can rewatch it again with my girlfriend.

title: What a great movie it is
content: Good Will Hunting absolutely deserves the label "Timeless Classic" and with very good reasons: the movie not only asks the viewers to question the importance that high-education provides in a society in which the elite thrive but also to ask the same very basic question that Sean Robin Williams asks Will Matt Damon"What do you want?"With fantastic storyline-progression, real humanperformances and dialog which will remain etched in your mind forever make no mistake: you can watch this movie in any year and in any time and it will still have the same impact."How do you like them apples?" will be a rhetorical question you can't wait to use after you watch this. As the final shot ends with a car on a highway and the credits start to roll, you will be both satisfied at the ending while sad that the movie itself is over.Do not miss this. Ever,It's worth every minute.

title: Overshadowed by the Big Boat
content: If it weren't for that damn Titanic movie(don't get me wrong I didn't hate Titanic) the Best Picture Race would've been a lot more interesting. The Full Monty still would've been a long shot but that leaves you with three of the greatest movies in recent years: L.A Confidential, As Good As it Gets, and my personal favorite, Good Will Hunting. Good Will Hunting is a movie masterpiece. Matt Damon and Ben Afleck are sensational actors and even better writers. Robin Williams finally got an Oscar(long overdue) for what I think might be his best performance yet, second only to Dead Poets Society. The chemistry between Williams and Damon is remarkable. Minnie Driver was great too. This is definitely a must see!

title: Good and Chill Movie, Nothing Spectacular :)
content: It's not a bad movie, but I think it's a bit overpraised.Matt Damon was my favorite actor when I was growing up and now I'd say he's still in there somewhere :)Damon and Affleck's script certainly deserves the admiration it has received and the acting, including that of the great Robin Williams, is not to be missed!The story is very well told and I can see why it gets the acclaim that the film has, but I just found the story a bit trite and not all that interesting. Nothing special.However, given the aforementioned positives, I can't deny that I enjoyed the film. It's cool, it's worth a watch and I would recommend it by the way.Final score: 6/10.

title: Moving coming of age story - but not for me.
content: It is for sure a great movie, me personally wasn't really 'grapped' by it. I appreciate the strong story line and the strong characters which are exposed gracefully. But personally, the story was for me way too slow, way too obvious and way too much cliche (personally! - the lost boy and the grand 'dad' who mentors him...?).Still, greatly executed. But might not rewatch it.

title: Not So Good Will Hunting
content: Good Will Hunting is a story about a genius who for various reasons has not been able to take advantage of this and, when we are introduced to him in the film, is working as a cleaner at a university. This guy's name is Will Hunting and he is played by Matt Damon. He solves a ridiculously difficult maths problem and is found by a maths teacher at the school played by Stellan Skarsgård. And it goes from there.I think that if I had watched this movie when it was released, prior to Matt Damon and Ben Affleck's careers, I would've been able to enjoy it much more. Since they have both written the script and play leading roles in the film it's hard not to judge it with this in mind. Neither Damon nor Affleck appear to be people who would pick fights, rather they appear to be people who would avoid something like that to a large extent in order to not danger their good looks. They are very much cast against type, but that ties in with the fact that most likely one of the main reasons they wrote this script was to shape roles for themselves to launch their respective careers. I would have no problem with this, if this was a good movie, which unfortunately, it is not. Minnie Driver also is not good looking enough for her part to be believable.Gus Van Sant is one of my favorite directors, although I find his later more "experimental" movies - like Elephant, Paranoid Park and Psycho - much more rewarding as opposed to his earlier work which is more conventional and main stream. The main problem with this film though lies within the script, so I suppose he did what he could with what he was given in this case. For a movie to be entertaining, gripping and interesting, you need a conflict. I fail to find such a thing in this motion picture, and I did look for it the entire running time.It is a mystery as to what you are supposed to feel for the main character in this film. It is hard to feel pity for him since he himself is the main obstacle to getting what he wants, success, money, respect and so on. Many people try to help him but he fights them with all he has got. He has the personality of a spoiled brat (funny enough that in the picture this is the very opposite of what he is supposed to be: A poor bastard who has had to fight his way to survive). It is also hard to identify with him since a very small percentage of the viewers of this film are geniuses who has not had to lift a finger to get where they are.It's easier to understand the problems of this movie if you compare it to a film about a similar subject which actually works. In Rain Man the main character truly is pitiful. His fate is a sad one since he is gifted but his disability has rendered him unable to interact normally with other people. The film is gripping since the viewer feels for the main character and his brother trying so desperately to reach him and find a place for him in this world.In a word you can sum up this film as plastic or fake: It's a pseudo-intellectual movie of the worst sort, it tries to go deep but only scratches the surface. A positive: Robin Williams does a great job with his role, he always seems to do better when he is given a serious part to play. When I saw Matt Damon in this film all I could think of was his involuntary part in Team America: World Police. "MATT DAMON!". Even though he was played by a doll in that film, his part seemed more real than in Good Will Hunting.

title: Incredible Performances
content: This is some of Robin Williams best work. Before watching this movie all I knew was that it was a written by Matt Damon and Ben Affleck. I think the pacing is good, plot is developed and I really enjoyed the dynamic between Robin Williams and Matt Damon. Great film.

title: Great writing
content: A very engaging film with good dialogue, with an academic and therapy backdrop.There is some fruity gritty language, romantic drama and one or two action scenes.This was well written by Damon and Affleck at relatively youthful ages.There are good interactions between the characters. Particularly so, Sean and Will, Chuckie and Will and Skylark and Will. The acting is to a high standard all-round.One scene appears to have been influenced somewhat by Cyrano de Bergerac. Robin Williams gives a pared-down performance with just a couple of moments of trademark tomfoolery. I enjoyed Minnie Driver's performance.

title: Hunting is a believable character
content: I did not think this movie was great, but I did like it.  However, I do not feel the characters in this movie are unrealistic, as some have complained. I felt the character of Will Hunting, who seems to be the most maligned, was very real.  Maybe the problem is that people have gotten so used to seeing characters who are one-dimensional and non-contradictory, even though this is not what people are like in real life.  Will Hunting is a mathematical genius, but this in no way means that he should behave intelligently in all domains of his life.  Hence, it is not unrealistic for him to behave stupidly when it comes to women.  Nor is it unrealistic for him to work as a janitor.  In my experience, people often do things that could not be predicted from their intelligence or abilities alone.  I myself have done things that I intellectually knew were stupid or detrimental; I'm sure most people have, and a mathematical genius should be no exception.  The character of Hunting struck me very much as a guy who has a problem with sabotaging his own happiness and success, maybe out of fear of greater failure should he put himself on the line.  His amazing abilities do not necessitate that he have a good job and a university degree, because it is not just intelligence that determines these things.  In school, perhaps he skipped all his classes and never did his assignments, and thus got poor grades.  That being the case, he would not have been accepted to a prestigious university, and in fact no one might have noticed his affinity for math.  It is also possible he simply didn't apply to university, even though he might have been accepted, either to stay with his friends or to prevent academic failure.  I think one of the points of this movie is that being gifted does not by itself make you happy and successful.  Being gifted does not make you immune to psychological problems, or make you behave in an intelligent manner in all situations.  If his character had been written this way- well, first off, there wouldn't be a movie.  Secondly, that would have made his character completely unbelievable.  I do concede that the likelihood of a genius being a janitor is not that great, but it is not impossible, and I'm sure it happens.  There are historical figures that we now recognise as great, even though in their time they were ignored or ridiculed for their beliefs.  There are also nutty geniuses, who cut off their ears and what not.  In light of such things and of my own personal experiences, I don't see any reason why Hunting can't be as screwed up as the rest of us.

title: Would have liked it better if it had been hyped less
content: I finally got around to seeing this film and frankly, with all the hype that surrounded it when it was new, I had expected something better.  It's interesting that it's a film written by two childhood friends and that they made it big.  It's less interesting as a film, period.  Don't get me wrong; it's not really a BAD movie, it's just an average movie with nothing terribly surprising, innovative, or new, and it had a big reputation to live up to.The concept of a genius in janitors' clothing was new to me, and while it's refreshing to see a topic in a movie that hasn't been in a hundred movies before, the way the rest of the story played out was somewhat predictable. Didn't mean I didn't like it, just that I wasn't surprised by it.  I was expecting something a bit more surprising or shocking, and frankly the only thing shocking about this movie was the language.  Couldn't it have been made without quite so much profanity?Some of the lines were quite a pleasure to watch -- especially Will's brainy monologues.  And the acting was all around quite good, especially by Minnie Driver and the two leading male characters (Matt Damon's Will and Ben Affleck's character).  Overall this isn't going to be one of my favorites, but I'm not sorry I watched it.

title: GOOD WILL HUNTING (DIDIER BECU)
content: Normally I hate films with good messages but this one was different and there are different reasons for it. Just let me tell that I couldn't believe my eyes when I noticed this movie was ranked among the 250 best movies ever as that's certainly not the case as it's the kind of movie you have seen before...It's the story about some janitor (Matt Damon) who happens to be a math-genius but he prefers to hang out with his friends (Ben Affleck) beating up some guys. Everything changes till he met Sean, a psychiatrist (Robin Williams). Matt Damon plays his role in a perfect way and he could be one of the better actors of these days as he plays the streetguy in a pure James dean/Marlon Brando-way, tons better than Affleck who seems a bit lost here. And finally a normal Robin Williams and it's a shame noticing how great his acting is, how much he can handle and knowing he wasted so many talent in c**p like "Toys"."Good will hunting" is a great movie that deserves two hours of your time, but not a place in the Top 250.

title: Robin Williams Stole Burt Reynolds Oscar!!
content: This awful movie made a lot of money, but that doesn't mean it was good, as a matter of fact it was excruciating. Yet another over rated movie that was simply painful and boring to watch. This story is so preposterous, poorly acted it makes me crazy. This is an insult to cinema goers,with Robin Williams playing the same character he did in Dead Poets Society, Awakenings and Patch Adams and for that alone it is just plain despicable.No other film was as clichéd and pathetic as this was. I cannot remember a film so pointless and laughable as this dreadful movie was. In a year of so many horrible films, this was the worst excuse for a film I can think of. This film was so torturous I cannot put it into words. I detested every second. I am mad that I wasted my life by seeing this idiotic film. That is when you know a movie is bad.And to top it off Robin Williams Stole Burt Reynolds Oscar (Boogie Nights)

title: Maths does lead to love
content: There are some movies after we watch them we wish we had never watched them, and there are some other, we wish we forget watching them start all over again. This one certainly falls into the later category.Math and romance go hand in hand through out the major part of the narration and the formula worked out really well. I quote, the formula and not the hypothesis.To put it in a mathematical perspective, the roots of movie are perfect making it a perfect square of romance and drama. Perfect square of denail and uncertainty of the lead role. Perfect square of professor and psychiatrist classmates and link to the lead role. Perfect square of friends and love life of lead role. There's no negativity touch that lead to the imaginary root. With mathematics as soul and a face for romance and appropriate limbs made it a perfect character to make time to watch it atleast once if not many times.

title: good
content:
First of all, what should happen in a masterpiece movie...? I can say that the answer to the question is hidden in this film...
i think what the director does best adjusts the emotionality of the film in such a setting and consistency that it prolongs the pain, and it turns out to be an amazing movie, I think I've never watched such a good movie about friendship, here, here, the quality smells, you won't understand how you started the movie and when it ends, you'll even find yourself praying that the movie doesn't end, and most importantly, of course, the exaggerated and excellent acting choice François Cluzet, I think, is a real he couldn't have been more paralyzed than paralyzed, he showed impeccable acting, and of course our babysitter Omar Sy was such a warm, sincere and deeply emotional babysitter, the room was perfect, as a result, I can say a solid masterpiece that will pass you out and you will never forget, I highly recommend, by the way, the music at the end of the movie, I think I've listened to it for two minutes 20 times, Dec...

title: I love it!
content: I cherish the moment in Good Will Hunting where Sean Maguire, played by Robin Williams, converses with Will Hunting, played by Matt Damon, on a park bench about life, love, and identity. The scene is more than just a dialogue. It is a monologue delivered with exceptional passion by Robin Williams, which always gives me goosebumps. Many other scenes in the movie have also left me in awe, such as the conversation between Sean Maguire and Professor Lambeau about ego and missed opportunities and the scene where Sean narrates Game 6 of the World Series to Will. The final scene between Will and Sean is also remarkable, but I don't want to spoil it for those who haven't seen the movie. The screenplay by Matt Damon and Ben Affleck is one of my favorites, and it has many great moments that I love. Even the scenes between Matt Damon and Ben Affleck or Damon and Minnie Driver are exceptional, but I still can't mention them in my top five favorite scenes because there are so many great moments in the movie. It is simply one of the best-written movies ever made, and Robin Williams gave his best performance in it.

title: One of Damon and Affleck's best performances
content: I borrowed this movie from my grandma one time.  As I sat down to watch it, I noticed that it had a lot of the "F" word in  it.  Still, however, it is a wonderful film and I recommend it to all my friends and family.  The actors were great, but I really liked Robin William's performance as the counselor. Williams always seems to be a great actor.  Aside from Williams, Matt Damon was a great performer as the college custodian.Don't take it from me, see this film for yourself.

title: Close, but no cigar
content: Good Will Hunting is a good movie, no question. It is a long way, however, from a great movie. As I watched the film I honestly enjoyed it and found it credibly done, but as I came away, I had a lingering sense that I had been duped. This movie is not worth all the hoopla (and awards) it garnered, something I can only attribute to Ben and Matt's 'fresh' faces. The story is a long way from original, following fairly predictable routes, some scenes badly expose the immaturity of the writers. Once again, a good movie, not a great movie.

title: The first hour was great but Matt Damon's shtick gets old very fast after that!
content: So I'm watching this for the first time ever. I find Matt Damon's character interesting. I can't get my eyes off his nose, and how much better looking he was with a very fat nose. (WHO decided that LaToya shrunken noses were attractive?!) And what a pity he had it redone. (Reminded me of Michelle Williams and how impossibly gorgeous she was with that fat nose of hers in Dawson's Creek and how Yerevan-waxwork she now looks when she had it cut to play that skunk with an A, marilyn monroe!)Anyway, I like old movies, so at first I'm like "Hey! Movies in the 90s were good, even if I didn't like them and didn't watch them then." Damon is captivating with his mind-games. Then Robin Williams appears and I have to scramble here: he actually made 2 similar movies?? I thought I was watching Dead Poets Society??? Hmm...blackboard, RW teaching kids and chalk. 2 movies the same year, yeah??And what does Good Will Hunting mean? See? That's why I never bothered with this film: not only was the overhype a killer for me at the time... (if you're one of those idiots who runs to the movies cos everyone is talking at the office of a film you don't know and you wanna be one of the "cool kids" at the office... you're an idiot!!! I was there to work, not socialize with morons!) ...but I couldn't understand the title. WHO wants to see a movie that says "Good Will Hunting". Will... is that a verb? Is that the noun, as in "you have strong will"? Obviously "hunting" is the verb. So what does a will (inheritance?) have to do with chasing foxes with dogs? I don't like hunting already! I love foxes. Is this gonna be a pretentious British movie where everyone talks funny? (Yep: Minnie Driver, the poor man's Mimi Rogers, actually ruined her career trying to outdo Meg Ryan a la "Hack Twah!" I think that's why she offed herself as she could never work in this town again.)Anyway, Robin Williams. He's dead. Awww... let me go get my violin. Never liked the guy. But the dynamic psychologist/patient is solid. What is Ben Affleck doing in this movie? "I wrote it, we drew straws and I lost and my buddy gets the good part now? I better start drinking my troubles away...." (Is this how his J-Lo cheating ways started??)Anyway this is a movie for all the young girls who are still so stupid they say: "But I can change him!" No, you can't and you ain't! (Ask J-Lo) Watch Matt Damon's character and learn.For the rest, the movie goes downhill fast in part 2. Is it in hour 2? IDK. It gets tedious. I lost interest. I started tinkering on my PC since I was forced to search and find out there were TWO 3-word films starring chalk, kids, blackboards and Robin Williams (do I have to watch DPS now??) and there ya go. Every once in a while I glanced up and I was bored so I read reviews.When RW started "It's not your fault", I already knew it was coming so I was unimpressed other than thinking did it take Matty 45 takes to start bawling Also, it made me think about killers rotting in jail for offing paid d'oh!-zes cos no one ever told THEM it was not their fault.Bla bla bla. First part of the movie is a 10/10. It crumbles down somewhere in the middle and now I have no idea how it ends but I don't care. It's probably more of a 5/10 or a 4/10 but I'm in a generous mood tonight. 6/10 for what it is.

title: No, Bad
content: I don't understand the hoopla for this movie.  It was all right, a couple of good moments, but it didn't add up to anything, and I completely forgot the entire experience ten minutes after I was outside the theatre.  Anyone who doesn't like a lot of swearing should stay away, too.  I swear at times, too, but not like these people.  For the most part, an unpleasant time.

title: The human mindset as an open book.
content: A lot of people are trying to hide their feelings behind their behaviour like Matt in this movie. When you went through difficult times, you never felt love, you don't know what unconditional guidance means you are afraid of many things but the most from your own self.This movie shows us the mindset and the feelings behind the "titles", it shows us what human connection means and how difficult is to achieve it!The plot is more than a story about a genius guy and a success story, it's a diamond of psychology into two hours.I definitely recommend it and I also recommend to see the real meaning and not just the affairs.

title: Question your life at peace
content: This movie will definitely make you question your decisions in life.It will also teach you how to not be on the ball.This is such a relaxing movie, I don't know how they achieved that. Please give it one go, I'm sure you are not going to be disappointed.

title: incredible
content: An incredible movie that tells a great story. Scenes midway through the movie got a little slow and made it difficult to get through. The ending finishes on a wonderful note.

title: So good
content: I think this may be Robin William's finest role. His eyes show such caring and such pain, just like his character. Sadly this may not have been completely the character, pointing to the beauty all the more. This story knows what it is, and sticks with it.

title: Perfect
content: I watch this movie every 3 or 4 months, and it is never planned, I will just be looking for a movie to watch, and then I come across this and it is better than any other movie I will find. I am a sucker for feel-good, life lessons learned, and somewhat romantic movies, and this fits that perfectly.The emotions that are conveyed throughout the entire film feel genuine and real, and it makes you really connect and almost root for the characters to do the right things.The background of knowing Damon hangs around a group of guys that have lived in the same place all their life, working construction and drinking beer, getting in fights and running from the cops really sets the stage for who he is.Robin Williams was so perfect in his role, and the relationship they build in the short two hours we have for the film is truly inspiring, because in a way they helped each other.My two favorite scenes are by far the Pudge Fisk home run scene and the "It's not your fault" scene. The emotions are raw and it is where you really start to see Will Hunting understand what Sean has been trying to teach him all along.With that being said, this film is perfect, and I gotta go see about a girl. Chills.

title: imperfect but highly watchable and well-made
content: Absorbing and thought-provoking story from director Gus Van Sant about a brilliant but deeply troubled young man. Damon, in a strong, credible performance, is Will Hunting, a feckless, bellicose native of South Boston with a genius IQ and an aptitude for mathematics even though he spends his days getting into legal troubles with his buddies and working as a janitor at an upscale university. When a renowned professor discovers this, he sends Will to the only person who can get through to him: maverick psychologist Williams, who has his own emotional baggage. From a screenplay by actors Matt Damon and Ben Affleck the film isn't always on target, especially with an abundance of profane dialogue, but it holds you throughout and benefits from rock solid performances. ***

title: Who is perfect?
content: "you're not perfect, sport, and let me save you the suspense: this girl you've met, she's not perfect either. But the question is whether or not you're perfect for each other."

title: Good, But Not Great: A Film That Shows Its Age
content: For me, Good Will Hunting felt quite predictable and cliché. I can understand why, considering the movie is fairly old, but by today's standards, it heavily relies on tropes we've seen many times before. That said, I can't say I disliked it. The movie doesn't really stand out compared to similar films, but for its time, I'm sure it was considered quite compelling.I went into the film with high expectations, given its reputation and the praise it has received over the years. However, I ended up feeling underwhelmed. While the performances, particularly from Matt Damon and Robin Williams, are undeniably strong, the story itself lacked the uniqueness or emotional depth I was hoping for.Overall, it's a decent film with some strong moments, but it didn't fully captivate me. My rating: 7/10.

title: A thoroughly predictable plot.
content: Within fifteen minutes, one knew how it going to end. Lacking any real narrative suspense, the film then could only be appreciated on a scene to scene basis. Furthermore, I couldn't bring myself to worry about someone with a 170 I.Q. I believe the film would have been much more interesting had it focussed on the Ben Affleck character

title: Powerful film
content: This film is just simply powerful. It states the situation of a man many people can relate to but few understand what's happening in his mindset. Any man out there who's gone through those motions of stuffing down emotions and bad feelings know how hard this hits home. Ladies, this movie is just simply a great flick and will give you an idea to how us men think. The plot of this movie is great, acting is fantastic, and it's moving. Matt Damon and Robin Williams killed it.

title: good
content: Stayed up half the night thinkin' about it. Something occurred to me. I fell into a deep, peaceful sleep, and I haven't thought about you since. You know what occurred to me?

title: Ideal
content: "Clever Will Hunting" is the picture where everything is fine and there is not even anything to find fault with. Here, a thoughtful script filled with capacious dialogues is combined with an amazing acting game.One of the most important problems of humanity at all times is raised here: love or success? For some reason, few people managed to combine these two important components and achieve absolute happiness. So the hero of the picture named Will at one point faced a difficult choice that would become fateful and determine his life path until his death. Such a scenario turn is good because the audience of "Clever Will Hunting" will always be divided into two camps. And this is great, because the film will remain in the memory for many years in this way.

title: A Pure Masterpiece for TEN
content: A great story full of twists and turns, filled with lessons for a lifetime. This was and still is an extraordinary piece by Matt and Ben. Also from the screenwriting point , this one is one of a kind. So effectivelly written with its characters really show their feelings without telling it. Just best of the best.

title: Outstanding individual scenes + moving overall story = My favorite movie ever
content: Some of my all-time favorite movie scenes come from this movie. There are amazing messages and themes regarding socioeconomics, talent, love, etc. All of these aspects of life are intertwined into one, beautifully written movie. Countless insights on these aforementioned aspects that I had never thought about were presented in this movie; so in a way this movie changed my view on life to a certain extent. Robin Williams is moving as always, and I believe this is his best role. The sum of extraordinary scenes produces my favorite movie of all time. Not to mention the story of how this movie was written. Pure genius.

title: Loved it!
content: GOOD WILL HUNTING ****1/2 The Weinstein and crew's bit of cinematic excellence boasts heartfelt drama, fresh humor, and interesting controversial issues from within. Working at the MIT as a janitor, Will Hunting (Matt Damon) becomes renown for his outstanding genius in mathematics. As the professors at the prestigious school in which he works try to force him to pursue his finesse, his personal problems hold him back. A troubled psychologist (Robin Williams) is the only man who can have him open his hurts so he can move forward in life. At least three major story lines occupy this picture, and Gus Van Sant keeps a firm handle on each.

title: good script hunting
content: Even though the film has been out a good few years, I only got round to watching this last night after many friends had bigged it up. To be honest I did enjoy the film, I thought the script was really good from damon and affleck and Williams performance was top notch and worthy of his Oscar. It was quite heart rendering. The fight scene on the baseball court was not very realistic, and even though Matt played the character of will being a disturbed and lonely young man very well, I didn't feel like he would be the person who could possibly scare anyone. I love the scene on the park bench and the conversation between Will and Shaun, and Shaun stating that just because he has read Oliver Twist it doesn't mean he understands what will has been through, excellent. Overall I really enjoyed the movie and was impressed.

title: Despite the strong language, an excellent script and complex characters.
content: As a film buff coming from a conservative background, I find myself struggling to evaluate honestly films containing strong language, particularly when it appears in such abundance as in this film.  But, bearing in mind that such language is endemic to the principal characters in the film, I found myself thoroughly entranced by Will's character development throughout the film.  The script and attendant dialogue carry the viewer along logically, both with respect to Will but also the Robin Williams character.  The development of these two fully-realized characters as their interactions cross provides real insight into the complexities of human nature. The supporting roles of the maths professor and the Minnie Driver characters only add to the painful but honest reality of this film.

title: um mm ewe
content: This movie was so boring. My friend and I had a marker fight in the back of the theater, we were so bored. Usually, I love anything Robin Williams is in. While I liked his performance, the rest of the actors and the movie, by definition blew. The plot was slow, the character development was slow. Everything was slow and boring. I am so glad I didn't pay for it, because I would have demanded my money back. I cant remember the last time I ever wasted two hours. I only went because I had a free pass. I am infinitely glad that Damon and Affleck haven't written anything so rampantly horrible since. One good thing about it was, that it cant get much worse than that, and their future attempts can only get better, cant they?

title: Fabulous
content: This movie is just fabulous! I am a huge Mat Damon fan and he really shines in this one. The script is excellent and the performances are deeply heartfelt. This is a movie that I watch again and again as it makes me cry. Please Hollywood - make more moves like this!

title: Great Actors. Incredible Story.
content:
One of the reason why i watch old movies is to find relics like this movie. A thoughtful, relatable, unbiased to someone who will watch them. It's not a love story, comedy, or tragedy. It's not heartbreaking, but it will make you cry, the reason being all the people you can be sentimental with don't have to stay, but you don't have to be alone either and meet new people along the way. 
And RIP Robin Williams, great performance there.

title: Very Nice
content: Psychological drama well in the beginning of Ben Aflleck and Matt Damon in their careers - they star (with Matt in the role of the protagonist) and wrote the script together. The director was Gus Van Sant (Drugstore Cowboy).The movie tells a story about a irish-descendant boy in Boston that works as janitor in a mathematics faculty, and it is a self-taught genius, with a troubled past and present - some mathematical riddles are left by the head of the chair in the faculty (Skarsgård) and mysteriously solved by night. Catching up with Matt Damon character Will he can be out of parole if he gets a job and consult with a psychiatrist what shows to be a tid bit tough thing.The film received positive reviews from critics and grossed over $225 million during its theatrical run against a $10 million budget, and received nominations in nine categories, including Best Picture and Best Director, and won in two: Best Supporting Actor for Williams and Best Original Screenplay for Affleck and Damon. Nothing bad, at all for someone being just out of Harvard University. Anther curiosity: character Skylar in the movie have the same name and background of Matt Damon's girlfriend back then.Robin Williams acts as the psychiatrist that could connect with this troubled boy, in a solid role - speaking of solid role it was nice to see Matt Damon out of some action movie in really nice drama scenes. Another actor that shows up is Stellan Skarsgård, yes the father of the four sons the most known being Bill (of "It").Nice heartwarming moving movie thought the end with a solid script. I would scorre it a 8.0 out of 10.0 / B+. It is strange that I didn't even reminded this one back in 97, but then I remembered that that year I was in the 3rd year of Medicine so not much time to seeing movies I guess.

title: Good film, but no classic
content: I have to admit that I enjoyed this film when it came out, much more than the heralded Titanic.  Its formulaic elements (the story is a meeting between Ordinary People and Little Man Tate) were appealing.Does it have it's flaws.  Yes.  It does go on a bit too long, and Minnie Driver's character borders on caricature.  But the rest of the film is amazing.Matt Damon sparks life into his already great role.  In a year where young actors did their best to impress, Matt Damon rode out on top (along with Edward Norton).  His performance is full of charm.  Robin Williams won a long-deserved oscar for a great performance, though it doesn't top his best (Mrs. Doubtfire).  The directing by Gus Van Sant is good, but doesn't top his best either (Drugstore Cowboy).All in all, a very good film, one that I will see again, but it isn't a classic.

title: My thoughts
content:
Good Will Hunting was a good movie, it shows that love can go a long way and in all different ways. Will Hunting double thinks but ends up going with his gut, i thought he should of went with the girl before she left. I see me in Will Hunting i double think but i go and get what i want, people judge Will even though they don't really know him people do that with me too. He has a different way of doing stuff and he's underestimated by others.
People don't think Will Hunting knows what he's talking about or doing because he's younger than them. But Will Hunting actually knows what he's talking about and doing, he's a smart guy. It doesn't better how young you are if you actually know what your talking about don't listen to what people got to say. Age doesn't matter if you know what your talking about. Will Hunting is a person who doesn't care what people say about him he would still go and do anything to help himself.
The only thing i didn't like was the cliffhanger in the end of the movie. I just wanted to see if he really made it to her or even to see if he married this girl. I rate this movie a 7, besides the ending i liked the whole movie. Will Hunting went with what his friends said they told him to go with his dreams without telling them when he's leaving and that's what he did. It was a great movie and i recommend this movie.

title: One of the best movies ever
content: How anyone saw this as a 1/10 FLOORS me! They must be emotionally dead! This movie had so many nuances that I've seen this at least 10 times and I see something new each time!! Robin Williams , IMHO, IS what makes this movie so very special. He resonates love and care for human beings. He's NOT driven by his ego, tho he was god enough to be. Enjoy this beautiful film. I certainly did . 10/10

title: Damon's career defining performance
content: 'Good Will Hunting' is one of the best known and most popular films of the 90s. It's a powerful, moving drama about an unlikely friendship and features some of the best and most memorable acting performances of that decade, including a career defining performance from Matt Damon as the title character.It's easy to become emotionally involved in this film as you naturally want the main character to succeed. The friendship he forms with Robin Williams' character is hugely enjoyable and even despite the slow pacing, the story is engaging enough to hold the viewers attention throughout. While not a personal favourite of mine, it's easy to see why 'Good Will Hunting' is loved by so many people, and deserves its reputation as one of the best films of the 90s.

title: An over-rated drama for popular culture
content: It's very predictable that a movie like this would soon be placed into that undefined category of "good" recent movies, which includes any film having the smallest bit of sincerity and meaning. The fact that the popular trend is toward the visual and that special effects are replacing plots and subtle nuances tends to lead the average viewer to the opinion that any film that attempts these is a grand effort. This is not true. "Good Will Hunting" does not even have a well-defined plot, but that fits into the movie acceptably: it's an extraordinary man's search for himself through love, psychoanalysis, and philosophy. The premier problem is that the movie overplays it's best card: Matt Damon's(character's) incredible brain. There is a certain point at which the audience should halt its fascination at his mental profencies and sigh in boredom. It's unfortunate that this was not the case for most theaters. Though the meaning of life and gifted individuals are good themes for movies, they are not original, and this "tear-jerker" makes no unique contributions to either idea. In fact, if you want to see real meaning in a popular movie, rent "Rocky", a title which many supposed "film experts" would probably not want to admit conveys deeper human meaning than most "good" movies, like (appropriately) Good Will Hunting. Shame on you,  movie fans, for falling in love with such a butchered attempt at profundity.

title: A real good movie!
content: If you like a good deep movie about your inner thoughts you are going too like this movie.

title: Even the title is inspiring
content: As I said, even the title is inspiring and meaningful.It's a masterpiece, I love it. This type of films with this level of quality are so so rare.Everything about this film is wonderful especially its screenplay which was written by Ben Affleck and Matt Damon.If it wasn't released on 1997 -the year that Titanic was released- it could have won all the Oscars which was nominated for.The most important aspect of this great film is all those moral messages.There are a lot of talks that you can find in this film that can be so powerfully and emotionally connected and relevant to you, and inspire and enlighten you.8.5/10.

title: Redemption
content: A story of RedemptionGood Will hunting is emotionally a motivational and feel good movie . Story of a poor and orphan youngster who is genius yet broken one , his well wishers trying and saving him from not wasting his potential . Damon & Affleck as writers did a great job in characterisation and dialogue writing , especially motivational dialogues weren't usual generic type , it was natural , genuine and simple yet hard hitting . Characterisation for each characters were well designed , especially Will's redemption arc and other characters contributing and helping him in redemption path were well shown . Romance track in the movie too worked well . Robbin Williams , Matt Damon and Ben Affleck delivered an immersive performance , other cast too did a great job . Music and songs were good and mind blowing .Didn't noticed any drawbacks .Overall , a classic feel good movie to watch which emotionally makes you chill and motivated at end .Must watch . Highly recommended .

title: WOW!
